Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::pieceCo.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::shortDe.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::keyFeat.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::manufac.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::modelNu.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::multipa.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::countPe.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::mainIma.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::product.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::animalT.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Type ==> The common generic name for the type of animal.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::animalB.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Breed ==> The specific breed or species of animal.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::animalL.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Lifestage ==> Age group of animals. Common labels include puppies, kittens, adult, and senior.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::minimum.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Animal Weight ==> The minimum weight of animal for which this product is intended.
Minimum Animal Weight ==> The minimum weight of animal for which this product is intended.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::maximum.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Animal Weight ==> The maximum weight of animal for which this product is intended.
Maximum Animal Weight ==> The maximum weight of animal for which this product is intended.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::petSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Pet Size ==> Size category of an animal (e.g. Small, Toy, Teacup, Medium, Large). Attribute most commonly used for products for dogs and cats. Size classification is often related to weight. (For dogs: Small = under 25 lbs. Med = 25 to 60 lbs. Large = over 60 lbs.) (For cats: Small = under 6 lbs. Med = 9-13 lbs. Large = over 14 lbs.) For specific weight range, also use Minimum Weight and Maximum Weight attributes. If product is articles of pet clothing, use "Clothing Size".

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::animalH.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Health Concern ==> Type of condition that the item is intended to address.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::dosage.walmart_attribute_doc: Dosage ==> The amount of a medication, drug, or supplement that is directed to be taken, or applied at one time or regularly during a period of time, as specified by the manufacturer.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::assembl.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::variant.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.
Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isPrima.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isProp6.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::prop65W.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::hasExpi.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::hasPric.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Price Per Unit ==> Mark as "Y" if your item is any of the following: food used for human or domestic animal consumption; ingredients added to food; napkins; tissues; toilet paper; foil, plastic wrap, wax paper, parchment paper; paper towels; disposable plates, bowls, and cutlery; detergents, soaps, waxes, and other cleansing agents; non-prescription drugs, female hygeine products, and toiletries; automotive fluids and cleaners; rock salt; diapers, pullups and swimmers; fertilizer; kitty litter.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::pricePe.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Quantity of Units ==> Enter the quantity of units for the item, based on the "PPU Unit of Measure" you selected. For example, a gallon of milk should be 128. NOTE: Do not enter the price.

PPU Unit of Measure ==> The units that will be used to calculate the "Price Per Unit" for your product. For example, a gallon of milk has a "PPU Unit of Measure" of Fluid Ounces. NOTE: This may not be the Unit of Measure on the label.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::hasWarr.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::warrant.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isNutri.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Nutrition Facts and Ingredient Label Required ==> Indicates if item requires nutritional facts labeling per FDA guidelines. If yes, please provide the following elements in one or more images 1) The Nutrition Facts and 2) Ingredients. Both attributes are required. If both elements are contained in one image, you may repeat the URL in both attributes.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::nutriti.walmart_attribute_doc: Nutrition Facts Label Image ==> Image URL of the nutritional facts label. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::hasIngr.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Ingredient List ==> Does your product have a list of ingredients OTHER than that provided with Drug Facts, Nutrition Facts, or Supplement Facts? If so, please provide EITHER the ingredients text or the URL to the image.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::ingredi.walmart_attribute_doc: Ingredient List Image ==> If your product contains a list of ingredients OTHER than that required with drug, supplement, or nutrition info, provide the URL of image. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

Ingredients Text ==> The list of all ingredients contained in an item, as found on the product label mandated by FDA guidelines. The ingredients should be listed in descending order by weight. The label must list the names of any FDA-certified color additives, but some ingredients can be listed collectively as flavors, spices, artificial flavoring or artificial colors. Refer to the FDA Food Labeling Guide for more guidelines.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isDrugF.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Drug Facts Label Required ==> Y indicates that your product is a drug as defined by the FDA. A drug is a substance intended for use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease. If yes, you must provide an image of: 1) your drug facts label, 2) dosage instruction/directions, and 3) active/inactive ingredients. All three image attributes are required. If your image contains more than one element, you may repeat the same image.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::drugFac.walmart_attribute_doc: Drug Facts Label Image ==> URL of the Drug Facts label's image. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension such as, .jpg, .png or .gif. (200 character max)

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::drugDos.walmart_attribute_doc: Drug Facts Dosage / Instructions Image ==> Please provide the image URL of the Dosage / Instructions, if not included in another image. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::drugAct.walmart_attribute_doc: Drug Facts Active / Inactive Ingredients Image ==> Provide a URL of the image containing the Active/Inactive Ingredients, if not included in another image.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::globalB.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::activeI.walmart_attribute_doc: Active Ingredients ==> The list of active ingredients in order of potency, as shown on the item label.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::inactiv.walmart_attribute_doc: Inactive Ingredients ==> The list of inactive ingredients in order of potency, as shown on the item label.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::stopUse.walmart_attribute_doc: Stop Use Indications ==> Text that describes symptoms, or lack thereof that indicate when to stop taking a medicine.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::form.walmart_attribute_doc: Form ==> Describes the way the item is dispensed or consumed, including its texture or other physical characteristics.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::scent.walmart_attribute_doc: Scent ==> Descriptive term for fragrance labeled on the product, if any. "Unscented" is a scent, if labeled. If no scent is specifically labeled, leave blank.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::hairLen.walmart_attribute_doc: Hair Length ==> The length of hair that grooming product is intended for.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::powerTy.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isDispo.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Disposable ==> Indicates the item is intended for single use.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::feature.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::keyword.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::instruc.walmart_attribute_doc: Instructions ==> Detailed information telling how the product should be operated or assembled.

Animal\/AnimalHealthAndGrooming::isRetra.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Retractable ==> Indicates that the item can be withdrawn into a holder, as in a cord or leash.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::capacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Capacity ==> A product's available space. Capacity is often provided for items that contain multiple pieces of something or that can accommodate some number of objects.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::shape.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::colorCategory.walmart_attribute_doc: Color Category ==> Select the color from a short list that best describes the general color of the item. This improves searchability as it allows customers to view items by color from the left navigation when they perform a search.

The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::isProp65Warni.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::prop65Warning.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::smallPartsWar.walmart_attribute_doc: Small Parts Warning Code ==> To determine if any choking warnings are applicable, check current product packaging for choking warning message(s). Please indicate the warning number (0-6). 0 - No warning applicable; 1 - Choking hazard is a small ball; 2 - Choking hazard contains small ball; 3 - Choking hazard contains small parts; 4 - Choking hazard balloon; 5 - Choking hazard is a marble; 6 - Choking hazard contains a marble.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::batteryTechno.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
Animal\/AnimalAccessories::batteryTechno.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::requiresTexti.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::countryOfOrig.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::hasExpiration.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::hasPricePerUn.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Price Per Unit ==> Mark as "Y" if your item is any of the following: food used for human or domestic animal consumption; ingredients added to food; napkins; tissues; toilet paper; foil, plastic wrap, wax paper, parchment paper; paper towels; disposable plates, bowls, and cutlery; detergents, soaps, waxes, and other cleansing agents; non-prescription drugs, female hygeine products, and toiletries; automotive fluids and cleaners; rock salt; diapers, pullups and swimmers; fertilizer; kitty litter.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::pricePerUnitQ.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Quantity of Units ==> Enter the quantity of units for the item, based on the "PPU Unit of Measure" you selected. For example, a gallon of milk should be 128. NOTE: Do not enter the price.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::pricePerUnitU.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Unit of Measure ==> The units that will be used to calculate the "Price Per Unit" for your product. For example, a gallon of milk has a "PPU Unit of Measure" of Fluid Ounces. NOTE: This may not be the Unit of Measure on the label.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::hasFuelContai.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::fabricCareIns.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::globalBrandLi.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::instructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Instructions ==> Detailed information telling how the product should be operated or assembled.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::batteriesRequ.walmart_attribute_doc: Batteries Required ==> Are batteries required to use this item?

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::batterySize.walmart_attribute_doc: Battery Size ==> The size or form factor of a battery, as specified by its code. This lets customers know which size of battery to purchase to operate the device.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::isFoldable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Foldable ==> Indicates that an item can be folded.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::isReflective.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Reflective ==> Indicates that the item contains material that reflects light, especially for nighttime safety.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::isRetractable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Retractable ==> Indicates that the item can be withdrawn into a holder, as in a cord or leash.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::maximumTemper.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Temperature ==> The higher temperature limit or capacity of an item such as a heater or thermometer.
Maximum Temperature ==> The higher temperature limit or capacity of an item such as a heater or thermometer.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::minimumTemper.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.
Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::pattern.walmart_attribute_doc: Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::sportsLeague.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Animal\/AnimalAccessories::numberOfSteps.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Steps ==> The number of steps product has as in a ladder.

Animal\/AnimalFood::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Animal\/AnimalFood::keyFeatures/keyFeatu.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Animal\/AnimalFood::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Animal\/AnimalFood::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Animal\/AnimalFood::manufacturerPartNumb.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Animal\/AnimalFood::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Animal\/AnimalFood::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Animal\/AnimalFood::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Animal\/AnimalFood::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Animal\/AnimalFood::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Animal\/AnimalFood::productSecondaryImag.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Animal\/AnimalFood::animalBreed.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Breed ==> The specific breed or species of animal.

Animal\/AnimalFood::animalLifestage.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Lifestage ==> Age group of animals. Common labels include puppies, kittens, adult, and senior.

Animal\/AnimalFood::minimumWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Animal Weight ==> The minimum weight of animal for which this product is intended.

Animal\/AnimalFood::minimumWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Animal Weight ==> The minimum weight of animal for which this product is intended.

Animal\/AnimalFood::maximumWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Animal Weight ==> The maximum weight of animal for which this product is intended, in pounds.

Animal\/AnimalFood::maximumWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Animal Weight ==> The maximum weight of animal for which this product is intended, in pounds.

Animal\/AnimalFood::petSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Pet Size ==> Size category of an animal (e.g. Small, Toy, Teacup, Medium, Large). Attribute most commonly used for products for dogs and cats. Size classification is often related to weight. (For dogs: Small = under 25 lbs. Med = 25 to 60 lbs. Large = over 60 lbs.) (For cats: Small = under 6 lbs. Med = 9-13 lbs. Large = over 14 lbs.) For specific weight range, also use Minimum Weight and Maximum Weight attributes. If product is articles of pet clothing, use "Clothing Size".

Animal\/AnimalFood::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

Animal\/AnimalFood::petFoodForm.walmart_attribute_doc: Pet Food Form ==> The physical format of the animal food.

Animal\/AnimalFood::flavor.walmart_attribute_doc: Flavor ==> The distinctive taste or flavor of the item, as provided by manufacturer. This is used for a wide variety of products, including food and beverages for both animals and humans. This may also apply to non-food items that come in flavors, including dental products, cigars and smoker wood chips.

Animal\/AnimalFood::assembledProductLeng.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Animal\/AnimalFood::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

Animal\/AnimalFood::variantAttributeName.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Animal\/AnimalFood::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Animal\/AnimalFood::isProp65WarningRequi.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Animal\/AnimalFood::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Animal\/AnimalFood::hasExpiration.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.

Animal\/AnimalEverythingElse::isAerosol.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Aerosol ==> ‘Aerosol’ is defined by Walmart to include any item of Merchandise that contains a compressed gas or propellant (including bag-on-valve and other pressurized designs). If your product meets this definition, Mark Y and ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

Animal\/AnimalEverythingElse::batteryTec.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
