Clothing::clothingTopStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Top Style ==> Style terms descriptive of clothing tops.

Clothing::dressShirtSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Dress Shirt Size ==> A grouping of sizes for dress shirts based on collar measurement and sleeve measurement.

Clothing::sleeveStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Sleeve Style ==> Descriptive terms for the style of garment sleeves. Does not include descriptive terms for sleeve length (which appear under the Sleeve Length Style attribute).

Clothing::sleeveLengthStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Sleeve Length Style ==> Descriptive terms for sleeve length.

Clothing::shirtNeckStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Neck Style ==> A garment's neckline or neck style.

Clothing::collarType.walmart_attribute_doc: Collar Style ==> Style of collar, as expressed by shape or design.

Clothing::jacketStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Jacket Style ==> Styles specific to coats and jackets.

Clothing::suitBreastingStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Suit Breasting Style ==> The closure style of a suit jacket or coat; double-breasted suits have more fabric where they overlap in front and commonly have 2 rows of buttons.

Clothing::sweaterStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Sweater Style ==> Styles specific to sweaters.

Clothing::scarfStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Scarf Style ==> Styles specific to scarves.

Clothing::upperBodyStrapConfiguration.walmart_attribute_doc: Upper Body Strap Configuration ==> Strap configuration style for bras, swimsuit tops, leotards and other clothing tops.

Clothing::hatSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Hat Size ==> The sizing information specific to hats, ranging from 6 1/4 to 8 1/8. Generic sized (small/med/large) hats may not have this information (generic s/m/l size information should be entered under the "Clothing Size" attribute).

Clothing::hatStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Hat Style ==> Styles specific to hats.

Clothing::braStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Bra Style ==> Brassiere styles/defining features. Enter as many as are relevant to the bra. Do not enter strap styles here. To enter descriptive terms for strap styles, please use the "Upper Body Strap Configuration" attribute.

Clothing::braSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Bra Size ==> Bra size, consisting of band and cup. Use this attribute if the garment has both measurements. If the bra has standard clothing sizes (e.g. S, M, L), enter the size under "Clothing Size". NOTE: for garments that have chest size (measured as the largest part of the chest, i.e. some women's slips), use "Chest Size".

Clothing::chestSize\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Chest Size ==> Chest measurement in inches, around the largest part of the chest. Often used for men's jackets and women's full slips.

Clothing::chestSize\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Chest Size ==> Chest measurement in inches, around the largest part of the chest. Often used for men's jackets and women's full slips.

Clothing::pantRise.walmart_attribute_doc: Waist Rise ==> The height at which the waistline rests on the body.

Clothing::waistSize\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Waist Size ==> Waist measurement in inches, around the smallest section of the natural waist (typically located just above the belly button).

Clothing::waistSize\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Waist Size ==> Waist measurement in inches, around the smallest section of the natural waist (typically located just above the belly button).

Clothing::pantySize.walmart_attribute_doc: Panty Size ==> Panty size. Generic sized (small/med/large) panties may not have this information (generic s/m/l size information should be entered under the "Clothing Size" attribute). Clothing size style values (Plus Size, Petite, Juniors, etc) should be entered under the "Clothing Size Style" attribute.

Clothing::skirtLength\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Skirt Length ==> The measurement of the skirt, from waist to bottom hem, in inches.

Clothing::skirtLength\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Skirt Length ==> The measurement of the skirt, from waist to bottom hem, in inches.

Clothing::legOpeningCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Leg Opening Cut ==> How high on the body the leg opening sits. Commonly referenced for leotards, swimwear, underwear or other legless garments.

Clothing::pantLegCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Pant Leg Cut ==> Common style terms describing how the garment leg has been cut to make a specific sillhoutte/shape.

Clothing::jeanStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Jean Style ==> Style terms specific to jeans.

Clothing::jeanWash.walmart_attribute_doc: Jean Wash ==> Description of post-process wash treatment effecting the appearance of dye and fabric texture, specific to jeans.

Clothing::jeanFinish.walmart_attribute_doc: Jean Finish ==> Fabric finishes specific to jeans.

Clothing::pantSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Pant Size ==> A composite of Waist Size and Inseam. Do not fill in this attribute if you have separately filled in both "Waist Size" and "Inseam". If the pant size is in numbers (e.g. 12) or standard sizes (e.g. Large), enter the information under "Clothing Size".

Clothing::pantFit.walmart_attribute_doc: Pant Fit ==> Terms that describe the way pants will fit when worn.

Clothing::pantStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Pant Style ==> Style terms specific to pants.

Clothing::beltStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Belt Style ==> Styles specific to belts.

Clothing::beltBuckleStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Belt Buckle Style ==> Belt buckle configurations.

Clothing::pantyStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Underpant/Swim Bottom Style ==> Descriptive styles common to underwear bottoms and lower body elements of swimwear and leotards.

Clothing::shortsStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Shorts Style ==> Styles specific to shorts.

Clothing::skirtAndDressCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Skirt Style ==> Terms describing a garment's skirt style, applicable to dresses and skirt products.

Clothing::skirtLengthStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Skirt Length Style ==> Descriptive terms for length specific to skirts and dresses.

Clothing::hosieryStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Hosiery Style ==> Styles/features specific to tights and hosiery.

Clothing::tightsSheerness.walmart_attribute_doc: Sheerness ==> Sheerness/opacities specific to tights and hosiery.

Clothing::underwearStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Underwear Style ==> Descriptive styles specific to underwear.

Clothing::sockSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Sock Size ==> Sock size. Generic sized (small/med/large) socks may not have this information (generic s/m/l size information should be entered under the clothing size attribute).

Clothing::sockStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Sock Style ==> Styles specific to socks. Does not include descriptive terms for sock height - those are in the Sock Rise attribute.

Clothing::sockRise.walmart_attribute_doc: Sock Rise ==> Descriptive terms for sock height.

Clothing::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Clothing::fabricCareInstructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

Clothing::accentColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Accent Color ==> A secondary product color.

Clothing::clothingWeight.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Weight ==> Commonly used in retail clothing, these terms describe the density or weight of fabric material.

Clothing::clothingStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Style ==> Styles and designations that apply generally to various types of clothing.

Clothing::clothingFit.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Fit ==> Terms that describe the way a garment will fit when worn. Does not include fit values specific to pants.

Clothing::clothingCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Cut ==> Common clothing cut styles.

Clothing::clothingLengthStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Clothing Length Style ==> Descriptive terms for where on the lower-body a garment ends.

Clothing::fastenerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Closure Type ==> The type of fastener used to keep a garment closed on the wearer and to facilitate putting on the garment.

Clothing::swimsuitStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Swimsuit Style ==> Descriptive styles common to swimwear. Style terms specific to the bottom half of swimwear appear under the Underpant/Swim Bottom Style attribute.

Clothing::dressStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Dress Style ==> Style terms specific to dresses. Other style terms that specifically describe a dress's skirt may be found under the Skirt Style attribute. Some values are shared between skirts and dresses: both "mini" dresses and "mini" skirts exist as separate products.

Clothing::gotsCertification.walmart_attribute_doc: GOTS Certification ==> Y indicates the product is certified under requirements of the Global Organic Textile Standard.

Clothing::theme.walmart_attribute_doc: Theme ==> A dominant idea, meaning, or setting applied to an item. Used in a wide range of products including decorative objects, clothing, toys, and furniture. Can be an important selection criteria for consumers who want to achieve a particular ambiance for room décor or for a special occasion.

Clothing::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

Clothing::globalBrandLicense.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

Clothing::sportsLeague.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Clothing::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Clothing::occasion.walmart_attribute_doc: Occasion ==> The particular target time, event, or holiday for the product.

Clothing::activity.walmart_attribute_doc: Activity ==> The general type of activity one might perform while wearing this garment.

Clothing::sport.walmart_attribute_doc: Sport ==> If the product is sports-related, the name of the specific sport depicted on the product, or the target sport for the product use

Clothing::season.walmart_attribute_doc: Season ==> If designed to be used during a specific type of year, the appropriate season this item may be used.

Clothing::weather.walmart_attribute_doc: Weather ==> The type of weather the clothing or fashion accessory was designed for.

Clothing::isMaternity.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Maternity ==> Is this item marketed specifically to women who are pregnant?

Clothing::academicInstitution.walmart_attribute_doc: Academic Institution ==> Name of College or other school. This is to distinguish the school from its sports team.

Clothing::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

Clothing::autographedBy.walmart_attribute_doc: Autographed by ==> The full name of the person who has autographed this copy.

Clothing::braBandSize\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Bra Band Size ==> A measurement in inches of the band of the bra, which fits around the ribcage just under the bust. Use this if the garment has a band size only or to separate band and cup size for search discovery.

Clothing::braBandSize\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Bra Band Size ==> A measurement in inches of the band of the bra, which fits around the ribcage just under the bust. Use this if the garment has a band size only or to separate band and cup size for search discovery.

Clothing::braCupSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Bra Cup Size ==> A letter size to optimize bra fit, calculated by measuring the chest at its widest point and subtracting the bra band size. 1 inch corresponds to 1 cup letter (e.g. if the difference is 5, the bra cup size is DD or E). Use this to record separate cup sizes for search discovery.

Clothing::neckSize\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Neck Size ==> Neck size in inches.

Clothing::neckSize\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Neck Size ==> Neck size in inches.

Clothing::sleeveLength\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Sleeve Length ==> The distance from the shoulder to the bottom hem of the sleeve, measured in inches.

Clothing::sleeveLength\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Sleeve Length ==> The distance from the shoulder to the bottom hem of the sleeve, measured in inches.

Clothing::inseam\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Inseam ==> For pants, the distance from the bottom of the leg to the seam in the crotch, measured in inches.

Clothing::inseam\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Inseam ==> For pants, the distance from the bottom of the leg to the seam in the crotch, measured in inches.

Clothing::isMadeFromRecycledMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Made From Recycled Material ==> Indicates that the item is made from recycled materials.

Clothing::recycledMaterialContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Recycled Material Content ==> If item contains reused/recycled material, the percentage of all recycled material used to produce the item. This can also include specific material composition; cushions made from 30% recycled cotton fabric. Used to highlight sustainability to the customer.

Clothing::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Clothing::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Electronics\/VideoGames::shortDescriptio.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Electronics\/VideoGames::keyFeatures/key.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Electronics\/VideoGames::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Electronics\/VideoGames::manufacturerPar.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/VideoGames::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/VideoGames::multipackQuanti.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Electronics\/VideoGames::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Electronics\/VideoGames::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Electronics\/VideoGames::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Electronics\/VideoGames::productSecondar.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Electronics\/VideoGames::variantAttribut.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Electronics\/VideoGames::isPrimaryVarian.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Electronics\/VideoGames::ratingReason.walmart_attribute_doc: Rating Reason ==> The reason for the rating of an entertainment product, such as a TV show, Movie, or Musical Album. Electronics\/VideoProjectors::throwRatio.walmart_attribute_doc: Throw Ratio ==> A projector's throw ratio is defined as the distance (D), measured from lens to screen, that a projector is placed from the screen, divided by the width (W) of the image that it will project (D/W).

Electronics\/VideoProjectors::hasBatteri.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Batteries ==> "Battery or battery containing product" is defined by Company to include any item of Merchandise that is a battery or any component of Merchandise, including reusable packaging intended to stay in use with the item, containing a battery of any chemistry/ type. Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::key.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::bra.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::man.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::mod.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::mul.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::cou.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::pie.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::isP.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::isC.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Chemical ==> ‘Chemical’ is defined by Walmart to include any item of Merchandise that contains a powder, gel, paste, or liquid that is not intended for human consumption. ‘Chemical’ also includes the following types items that ARE intended for human consumption, inhalation, or absorption, or labeled with drug facts: All over-the-counter medications, including: Lozenges, pills or capsules (e.g. pain relievers; allergy medications; as well as vitamins and supplements that contain metals); Medicated swabs and wipes, acne medication, and sunscreen; Medicated patches (such as nicotine patches); Liquids (e.g. cough medicine, medicated drops, nasal spray and inhalers); Medicated shampoos, gums, ointments and creams; Medicated lip balm, lip creams and petroleum jelly; Contraceptive foam, films, and spermicides; and Product/Equipment sold with chemicals (e.g. vaporizer sold with medication) and electronic cigarettes. If your product meets this definition, Mark Y and ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

Electronics\/ElectronicsAccessories::dat.walmart_attribute_doc: Data Transfer Rate ==> The speed with which data can be transmitted from one device to another. Data rates are often measured in megabits (million bits) or megabytes (million bytes) per second. These are usually abbreviated as Mbps and MBps,respectively. Another term for data transfer rate is throughput.

Electronics\/ComputerComponents::warrant.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Electronics\/ElectronicsCables::modelNum.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/ElectronicsCables::multipac.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Electronics\/ElectronicsCables::countPer.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Electronics\/ElectronicsCables::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Electronics\/Computers::RAIDlevel.walmart_attribute_doc: RAID Level ==> In computer storage, the standard RAID levels comprise a basic set of RAID (redundant array of independent disks) configurations that employ the techniques of striping, mirroring, or parity to create large reliable data stores from multiple general-purpose computer hard disk drives (HDDs).

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::keyFea.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::manufa.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::modelN.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::multip.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::countP.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::mainIm.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::produc.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::resolu.walmart_attribute_doc: Resolution ==> The commonly used resolution category of best fit for the panel. 1080p for a native resolution of 1920 x 1080, 4K for a native resolution of 4096 x 2160, and so on. Or the upper-bound resolution of the video output capability of an item (on a BluRay player or streaming media device for example).

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::screen.walmart_attribute_doc: Screen Size ==> Typically measured on the diagonal in inches.
Screen Size ==> Typically measured on the diagonal in inches.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::displa.walmart_attribute_doc: Display Technology ==> The primary technology used for the item's display.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::televi.walmart_attribute_doc: Television Type ==> The type of TV with reference to its technology and capabilities.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::assemb.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::isProp.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::prop65.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::batter.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::batter.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::hasWar.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::warran.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::varian.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.
Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::isPrim.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::colorC.walmart_attribute_doc: Color Category ==> Select the color from a short list that best describes the general color of the item. This improves searchability as it allows customers to view items by color from the left navigation when they perform a search.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::connec.walmart_attribute_doc: Connector Type ==> The standardized connections provided on the item.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::memory.walmart_attribute_doc: Memory Card Format ==> The memory card format applicable to the product.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::hasTou.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Touchscreen ==> Does the display have touchscreen capabilities?

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::inputs.walmart_attribute_doc: Input/Output Type ==> Enter the type and quantity of each input and/or output connection provided on the product.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::isEner.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Energy Star Certified ==> Indicate Y if the product has been certified by the EPA Energy Star program.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::aspect.walmart_attribute_doc: Aspect Ratio ==> The proportional relationship between the display's width and its height. Commonly expressed as two numbers separated by a colon.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::native.walmart_attribute_doc: Native Resolution ==> The resolution of a flat panel display at which no scaling is used to create the images. This is the resolution that will render the highest picture quality when used with source material of a corresponding resolution.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::maximu.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Contrast Ratio ==> The ratio between the luminance of the brightest color to that of the darkest color capable of being displayed.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::refres.walmart_attribute_doc: Refresh Rate ==> Commonly the vertical refresh rate of the display. This is a measurement of the number of times the picture is updated per second, and should be recorded in Hz.
Refresh Rate ==> Commonly the vertical refresh rate of the display. This is a measurement of the number of times the picture is updated per second, and should be recorded in Hz.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::respon.walmart_attribute_doc: Response Time ==> The amount of time the pixels in the display take to change from one state to another. Measured in milliseconds.
Response Time ==> The amount of time the pixels in the display take to change from one state to another. Measured in milliseconds.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::backli.walmart_attribute_doc: Backlight Type ==> The backlighting used in the panel. Most commonly Cold Cathode Fluorescent Lamps (CCFLs) or Light Emitting Diodes (LED's).

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::hasInt.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Integrated Speakers ==> Does the item include speakers integrated into the body of the main item?

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::wirele.walmart_attribute_doc: Wireless Technologies ==> Any wireless communications standard used within or by the item.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::audioF.walmart_attribute_doc: Audio Features ==> Features intended to increase sound quality or fidelity.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::peakAu.walmart_attribute_doc: Peak Audio Power Capacity ==> The peak audio input power capacity this passive item can handle from an amplifier, expressed in watts. A passive item (device, speaker, etc.) has no internal amplifier; it must be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Peak Audio Power Capacity ==> The peak audio input power capacity this passive item can handle from an amplifier, expressed in watts. A passive item (device, speaker, etc.) has no internal amplifier; it must be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::audioP.walmart_attribute_doc: Audio Power Output ==> The audio output power of the amplifier or self-powered device's speakers, expressed in watts. A self-powered item has an internal amplifier; it does not need to be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::featur.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::keywor.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::stream.walmart_attribute_doc: Streaming Services ==> Services that come imbedded in an electronic product (TV, etc.) that are ready for customer subscription.

Electronics\/TVsAndVideoDisplays::mounti.walmart_attribute_doc: Mounting Pattern ==> Describes the horizontal and vertical distance between the screw centers of products such as TV/Monitor mounts, and TVs and monitors. Provides consumers the ability to select items based on TV/Monitor to mount compatibility.

Electronics\/PrintersScannersAndImaging:.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::shortDesc.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::keyFeatur.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::manufactu.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::modelNumb.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::multipack.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::countPerP.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::pieceCoun.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::peakAudio.walmart_attribute_doc: Peak Audio Power Capacity ==> The peak audio input power capacity this passive item can handle from an amplifier, expressed in watts. A passive item (device, speaker, etc.) has no internal amplifier; it must be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Peak Audio Power Capacity ==> The peak audio input power capacity this passive item can handle from an amplifier, expressed in watts. A passive item (device, speaker, etc.) has no internal amplifier; it must be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::audioPowe.walmart_attribute_doc: Audio Power Output ==> The audio output power of the amplifier or self-powered device's speakers, expressed in watts. A self-powered item has an internal amplifier; it does not need to be plugged into a power amplifier to produce sound.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::resolutio.walmart_attribute_doc: Resolution ==> The commonly used resolution category of best fit for the panel. 1080p for a native resolution of 1920 x 1080, 4K for a native resolution of 4096 x 2160, and so on. Or the upper-bound resolution of the video output capability of an item (on a BluRay player or streaming media device for example).

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::dataTrans.walmart_attribute_doc: Data Transfer Rate ==> The speed with which data can be transmitted from one device to another. Data rates are often measured in megabits (million bits) or megabytes (million bytes) per second. These are usually abbreviated as Mbps and MBps,respectively. Another term for data transfer rate is throughput.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::streaming.walmart_attribute_doc: Streaming Services ==> Services that come imbedded in an electronic product (TV, etc.) that are ready for customer subscription.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::speakerDr.walmart_attribute_doc: Speaker Driver ==> Drivers are a speaker component, which can be classified into several types depending on the configuration of their diaphragms.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::numberOfS.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Speakers ==> The number of speakers included in the product.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::impedance.walmart_attribute_doc: Impedance ==> Measurement in Ohms, of the electrical resistance a circuit presents to a current when a voltage is applied. Important characteristic for products such as transmitters, speakers, microphones, and headphones because it restricts ("impedes") the flow of power from the receiver or amplifier.

Impedance ==> Measurement in Ohms, of the electrical resistance a circuit presents to a current when a voltage is applied. Important characteristic for products such as transmitters, speakers, microphones, and headphones because it restricts ("impedes") the flow of power from the receiver or amplifier.

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::microphon.walmart_attribute_doc: Microphone Technology ==> Term describing the method the microphone’s design converts sound waves into electrical signals. Important to consumers because different microphone technologies are suited to different applications

Electronics\/ElectronicsOther::digitalAu.walmart_attribute_doc: Digital Audio File Format ==> The file format of the digital audio file.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::pri.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Quantity of Units ==> Enter the quantity of units for the item, based on the "PPU Unit of Measure" you selected. For example, a gallon of milk should be 128. NOTE: Do not enter the price.
