FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::vin.walmart_attribute_doc: Vintage ==> The year the item was created, such as for wine or cheese.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::isN.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Non-Grape ==> Indicates that wine was made from fruit other than grapes.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::isE.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Estate Bottled ==> Indicates that 100% of the wine came from grapes grown on land owned or controlled by the winery, which must be located in a viticultural area.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::con.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Sulfites ==> Indicates whether the beverage contains the level of sulfites required for labeling as such by law.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::tim.walmart_attribute_doc: Time Aged ==> Amount of time an item is aged, such as for whiskey or cheese.
Time Aged ==> Amount of time an item is aged, such as for whiskey or cheese.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::ing.walmart_attribute_doc: Ingredients Text ==> The list of all ingredients contained in an item, as found on the product label mandated by FDA guidelines. The ingredients should be listed in descending order by weight. The label must list the names of any FDA-certified color additives, but some ingredients can be listed collectively as flavors, spices, artificial flavoring or artificial colors. Refer to the FDA Food Labeling Guide for more guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage\/AlcoholicBeverages::con.walmart_attribute_doc: Container Type ==> The kind of physical package or receptacle that contains the product as presented to the consumer. Also used to describe storage items. Consumers may select different products based on their container preferences. For example, a parent may select juice packaged in boxes rather than bottles for use in childrens' lunch boxes.

FoodAndBeverage::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

FoodAndBeverage::keyFeatures/keyFeatures.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

FoodAndBeverage::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

FoodAndBeverage::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

FoodAndBeverage::manufacturerPartNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

FoodAndBeverage::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

FoodAndBeverage::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

FoodAndBeverage::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

FoodAndBeverage::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

FoodAndBeverage::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

FoodAndBeverage::productSecondaryImageUR.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

FoodAndBeverage::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

FoodAndBeverage::flavor.walmart_attribute_doc: Flavor ==> The distinctive taste or flavor of the item, as provided by manufacturer. This is used for a wide variety of products, including food and beverages for both animals and humans. This may also apply to non-food items that come in flavors, including dental products, cigars and smoker wood chips.

FoodAndBeverage::isReadyToEat.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Ready-to-Eat ==> Food that can be consumed without further preparation, according to FDA guidelines. For more information see FDA Food Code 2009: Chapter 1-201.10 Definitions.

FoodAndBeverage::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

FoodAndBeverage::meal.walmart_attribute_doc: Meal ==> A meal that is normally tied to a particular time of day: breakfast, lunch, dinner, tea.

FoodAndBeverage::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

FoodAndBeverage::variantAttributeNames\/.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

FoodAndBeverage::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

FoodAndBeverage::isProp65WarningRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

FoodAndBeverage::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

FoodAndBeverage::isNutritionFactsLabelRe.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Nutrition Facts and Ingredient Label Required ==> Indicates if item requires nutritional facts labeling per FDA guidelines. If yes, please provide the following elements in one or more images 1) The Nutrition Facts and 2) Ingredients. Both attributes are required. If both elements are contained in one image, you may repeat the URL in both attributes.

FoodAndBeverage::nutritionFactsLabel.walmart_attribute_doc: Nutrition Facts Label Image ==> Image URL of the nutritional facts label. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

FoodAndBeverage::nutritionIngredientsIma.walmart_attribute_doc: Nutrition Ingredients Image ==> URL of image. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

FoodAndBeverage::hasExpiration.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.

FoodAndBeverage::hasPricePerUnit.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Price Per Unit ==> Mark as "Y" if your item is any of the following: food used for human or domestic animal consumption; ingredients added to food; napkins; tissues; toilet paper; foil, plastic wrap, wax paper, parchment paper; paper towels; disposable plates, bowls, and cutlery; detergents, soaps, waxes, and other cleansing agents; non-prescription drugs, female hygeine products, and toiletries; automotive fluids and cleaners; rock salt; diapers, pullups and swimmers; fertilizer; kitty litter.

FoodAndBeverage::pricePerUnitQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Quantity of Units ==> Enter the quantity of units for the item, based on the "PPU Unit of Measure" you selected. For example, a gallon of milk should be 128. NOTE: Do not enter the price.

FoodAndBeverage::pricePerUnitUom.walmart_attribute_doc: PPU Unit of Measure ==> The units that will be used to calculate the "Price Per Unit" for your product. For example, a gallon of milk has a "PPU Unit of Measure" of Fluid Ounces. NOTE: This may not be the Unit of Measure on the label.

FoodAndBeverage::hasGMOs.walmart_attribute_doc: Has GMOs ==> Does your product contain Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOS) whose DNA has been altered using genetic engineering techniques?

FoodAndBeverage::isGmoFree.walmart_attribute_doc: GMO-Free Claim ==> Does your product make any claims about containing no Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) on its packaging, or in the description on the website?

FoodAndBeverage::servingSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Serving Size ==> Measurement value specifying the amount of the item typically used as a reference on the label of that item to list per serving information (nutrients, calories, total fat). Applicable for a wide variety of products including food, beverages, and nutritional supplements.

FoodAndBeverage::servingsPerContainer.walmart_attribute_doc: Servings Per Container ==> Number of servings contained in the item's package (box, bottle, bag).

FoodAndBeverage::calories\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Calories Per Serving ==> Number of calories contained in one serving, as found on the food label.

FoodAndBeverage::calories\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Calories Per Serving ==> Number of calories contained in one serving, as found on the food label.

FoodAndBeverage::caloriesFromFat\/measur.walmart_attribute_doc: Fat Calories Per Serving ==> Number of calories derived from fat, as found on the food label.

FoodAndBeverage::caloriesFromFat\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Fat Calories Per Serving ==> Number of calories derived from fat, as found on the food label.

FoodAndBeverage::totalFat\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Fat Per Serving ==> Total number of fat calories per serving, expressed in grams, milligrams, or less than a certain number of grams.

FoodAndBeverage::totalFat\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Fat Per Serving ==> Total number of fat calories per serving, expressed in grams, milligrams, or less than a certain number of grams.

FoodAndBeverage::totalFatPercentageDaily.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Fat Percentage Daily Value ==> Percent daily value of fat per serving, according to the food label.

FoodAndBeverage::fatCaloriesPerGram\/mea.walmart_attribute_doc: Fat Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of fat, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::fatCaloriesPerGram\/uni.walmart_attribute_doc: Fat Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of fat, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::totalCarbohydrate\/meas.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Carbohydrate ==> Total number of carbohydrates per serving, expressed in grams or less than a certain number of grams.

FoodAndBeverage::totalCarbohydrate\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Carbohydrate ==> Total number of carbohydrates per serving, expressed in grams or less than a certain number of grams.

FoodAndBeverage::totalCarbohydratePercen.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Carbohydrate Percentage Daily Value ==> Percent daily value of carbohydrates per serving.

FoodAndBeverage::carbohydrateCaloriesPer.walmart_attribute_doc: Carbohydrate Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of carbohydrates, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.
Carbohydrate Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of carbohydrates, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::nutrients.walmart_attribute_doc: Nutrients ==> Additional nutrients, not including total fat or total carbohydrates, which should be entered in "Total Fat" and "Total Carbohydrate" respectively.

FoodAndBeverage::proteinCaloriesPerGram\.walmart_attribute_doc: Protein Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of protein, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.
Protein Calories Per Gram ==> The number of calories in one gram of protein, as may be provided in Nutritional Facts according to FDA guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::totalProteinPercentageD.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Protein Percentage Daily Value ==> Percent daily value of protein per serving.

FoodAndBeverage::totalProtein\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Protein Per Serving ==> Total protein per serving, expressed in grams, milligrams, or less than.

FoodAndBeverage::totalProtein\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Protein Per Serving ==> Total protein per serving, expressed in grams, milligrams, or less than.

FoodAndBeverage::foodForm.walmart_attribute_doc: Food Form ==> Describes the form of the food if the food is sold in a variety of forms, such as sliced and unsliced, whole or halves, etc.

FoodAndBeverage::containerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Container Type ==> The kind of physical package or receptacle that contains the product as presented to the consumer. Also used to describe storage items. Consumers may select different products based on their container preferences. For example, a parent may select juice packaged in boxes rather than bottles for use in childrens' lunch boxes.

FoodAndBeverage::timeAged\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Time Aged ==> Amount of time an item is aged, such as for whiskey or cheese.

FoodAndBeverage::timeAged\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Time Aged ==> Amount of time an item is aged, such as for whiskey or cheese.

FoodAndBeverage::isImitation.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Imitation ==> Generally a new food that resembles a traditional food and is a substitute for the traditional food must be labeled as an imitation, especially if the new food contains less protein or a lesser amount of any essential vitamin or mineral.

FoodAndBeverage::ingredients.walmart_attribute_doc: Ingredients Text ==> The list of all ingredients contained in an item, as found on the product label mandated by FDA guidelines. The ingredients should be listed in descending order by weight. The label must list the names of any FDA-certified color additives, but some ingredients can be listed collectively as flavors, spices, artificial flavoring or artificial colors. Refer to the FDA Food Labeling Guide for more guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::usdaInspected.walmart_attribute_doc: USDA-Inspected ==> Has your product been inspected by the United States Department of Agriculture? There are a number of food products that are under the jurisdiction of the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS), and are thus subject to inspection, including: egg products (liquid, frozen or dried), meat, and poultry. Refer to the FDA / USDA Food Standards and Labeling Policy Book for exceptions and more detailed guidelines.

FoodAndBeverage::hasHighFructoseCornSyru.walmart_attribute_doc: Has High Fructose Corn Syrup ==> Select "Y" if High Fructose Corn Syrup is in the ingredient list.

FoodAndBeverage::foodAllergenStatements.walmart_attribute_doc: Allergens ==> Statement regarding any ingredients that may be food allergens, often written as "Contains X" or "Manufactured in a facility which processes Y."

FoodAndBeverage::instructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Instructions ==> Detailed information telling how the product should be operated or assembled.

FoodAndBeverage::caffeineDesignation.walmart_attribute_doc: Caffeine Designation ==> Differentiates between items that have no naturally occurring caffeine, caffeine removed by processing, naturally caffeinated, or added caffeine.

FoodAndBeverage::spiceLevel.walmart_attribute_doc: Spice Level ==> Level of spice (i.e. "hotness") in an item, if applicable.

FoodAndBeverage::isMadeInHomeKitchen.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Made in a Home Kitchen ==> Indicates if the item was made for consumption in a home kitchen, as defined by the FDA.

FoodAndBeverage::beefCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Beef Cut ==> Retail term describing the portion cut (vs. primal cut) based on the part of the animal the meat is cut from. Important selection criteria because different cuts of beef have different characteristics, uses, and preferred cooking methods. For example, chuck meat is from the cow’s shoulder and is typically tough, but flavorful and used for beef cuts such as ground chuck (hamburger) and stew meat.

FoodAndBeverage::poultryCut.walmart_attribute_doc: Poultry Cut ==> Term identifying the part of the bird (typically chicken, turkey, or goose). Important selection criteria because different cuts of poultry have different flavor and texture.

FoodAndBeverage::releaseDate.walmart_attribute_doc: Release Date ==> Indicates the release date of a product from the manufacturer, in the format yyyy-mm-dd. This will be the date on which distribution of the product will be initiated.

FoodAndBeverage::safeHandlingInstruction.walmart_attribute_doc: Safe Handling Instructions ==> Instructions for storage or preparation of potentially hazardous fresh food. NOTE: Required for raw meat products.

FoodAndBeverage::cuisine.walmart_attribute_doc: Cuisine ==> Indicates the cooking style, especially regional or cultural cuisines, you might use the food to prepare.

FoodAndBeverage::foodPreparationTips.walmart_attribute_doc: Food Preparation Tips ==> Helpful information related to food preparation.

FoodAndBeverage::foodStorageTips.walmart_attribute_doc: Food Storage Tips ==> Helpful information related to food storage.

FoodAndBeverage::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

Footwear::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Footwear::keyFeatures/keyFeaturesValue.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Footwear::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Footwear::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Footwear::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Footwear::manufacturerPartNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Footwear::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Footwear::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Footwear::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Footwear::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Footwear::productSecondaryImageURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Footwear::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Footwear::colorCategory\/colorCategoryVa.walmart_attribute_doc: Color Category ==> Select the color from a short list that best describes the general color of the item. This improves searchability as it allows customers to view items by color from the left navigation when they perform a search.

Footwear::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

Footwear::shoeSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Shoe Size ==> The alphanumeric representation of the size of the shoe, as issued by the manufacturer.

Footwear::pattern.walmart_attribute_doc: Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

Footwear::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

Footwear::gender.walmart_attribute_doc: Gender ==> Indicate whether this item is meant for a particular gender or meant to be gender-agnostic (unisex).

Footwear::ageGroup\/ageGroupValue.walmart_attribute_doc: Age Group ==> General grouping of ages into commonly used demographic labels.

Footwear::sport.walmart_attribute_doc: Sport ==> If the product is sports-related, the name of the specific sport depicted on the product, or the target sport for the product use

Footwear::shoeWidth.walmart_attribute_doc: Shoe Width ==> The width sizing of the shoe, if specified by the manufacturer.

Footwear::heelHeight\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Heel Height ==> Enter heel height in inches.

Footwear::heelHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Heel Height ==> Enter heel height in inches.

Footwear::shoeStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Shoe Style ==> Term identifying the group of shoes based on shared visual design characteristics (e.g. Loafer; Mary Jane; Moccasin).

Footwear::casualAndDressShoeType.walmart_attribute_doc: Shoe Attire ==> The formality or environment for a shoe

Footwear::shoeClosure.walmart_attribute_doc: Shoe Closure ==> Term that describe how a shoe is adjusted to fit around the foot. This may be important in shoe selection. For example, consumers that have difficulty tying lace-up shoes would prefer slip-ons or hook-and-loop shoe closures.

Footwear::isWaterResistant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Water-Resistant ==> Y indicates that the item has been especially made or treated to resist the effects of water, as specified by the manufacturer. Attribute used to identify a product feature. For example, allows consumers to select shoes that would resist being damaged in the rain.

Footwear::isOrthopedic.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Orthopedic ==> Indicates footwear designed to ease or improve musculoskeletal function.

Footwear::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

Footwear::variantAttributeNames\/variant.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Footwear::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Footwear::isProp65WarningRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Footwear::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Footwear::smallPartsWarnings\/smallParts.walmart_attribute_doc: Small Parts Warning Code ==> To determine if any choking warnings are applicable, check current product packaging for choking warning message(s). Please indicate the warning number (0-6). 0 - No warning applicable; 1 - Choking hazard is a small ball; 2 - Choking hazard contains small ball; 3 - Choking hazard contains small parts; 4 - Choking hazard balloon; 5 - Choking hazard is a marble; 6 - Choking hazard contains a marble.

Footwear::batteryTechnologyType.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
Footwear::batteryTechnologyType.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

Footwear::requiresTextileActLabeling.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Does your item contain wool? Please refer to the following URL for further information on the Textile Act: https://www.ftc.gov/tips-advice/business-center/guidance/threading-your-way-through-labeling-requirements-under-textile#5

Footwear::countryOfOriginTextiles.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

Footwear::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Footwear::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Footwear::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Footwear::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Footwear::fabricCareInstructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

Footwear::sportsLeague.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Footwear::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Footwear::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

Footwear::autographedBy.walmart_attribute_doc: Autographed by ==> The full name of the person who has autographed this copy.

Footwear::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

Footwear::globalBrandLicense.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

Footwear::occasion.walmart_attribute_doc: Occasion ==> The particular target time, event, or holiday for the product.

Footwear::recommendedLocations.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Locations ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.

Footwear::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Footwear::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Furniture::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Furniture::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Furniture::keyFeatures/keyFeaturesValue.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Furniture::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Furniture::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Furniture::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Furniture::manufacturerPartNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Furniture::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Furniture::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Furniture::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Furniture::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Furniture::productSecondaryImageURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Furniture::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Furniture::colorCategory\/colorCategoryV.walmart_attribute_doc: Color Category ==> Select the color from a short list that best describes the general color of the item. This improves searchability as it allows customers to view items by color from the left navigation when they perform a search.

Furniture::finish.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

Furniture::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

Furniture::pattern.walmart_attribute_doc: Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

Furniture::gender.walmart_attribute_doc: Gender ==> Indicate whether this item is meant for a particular gender or meant to be gender-agnostic (unisex).

Furniture::ageGroup\/ageGroupValue.walmart_attribute_doc: Age Group ==> General grouping of ages into commonly used demographic labels.

Furniture::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

Furniture::bedSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Bed Size ==> Denotes the size of a bed, a bed's parts, mattress or bed linens in standard sizes.

Furniture::homeDecorStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Home Decor Style ==> Describes home furnishings and decorations according to various themes, styles and tastes.

Furniture::seatingCapacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Seating Capacity ==> The number of people that can be accommodated by the available seats of an item.

Furniture::numberOfDrawers.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Drawers ==> The number of drawers included the furniture or storage unit.

Furniture::numberOfShelves.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Shelves ==> The number of shelves included in the furniture or storage unit.

Furniture::collection.walmart_attribute_doc: Collection ==> A collection is a particular group of items that have the same visual style, made by the same brand.

Furniture::theme.walmart_attribute_doc: Theme ==> A dominant idea, meaning, or setting applied to an item. Used in a wide range of products including decorative objects, clothing, toys, and furniture. Can be an important selection criteria for consumers who want to achieve a particular ambiance for room décor or for a special occasion.

Furniture::shape.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

Furniture::diameter\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Diameter ==> The measurement from one side of a circle to the other, through the middle.

Furniture::diameter\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Diameter ==> The measurement from one side of a circle to the other, through the middle.

Furniture::bedStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Bed Style ==> Describes the bed's shape and appearance according to its design features.

Furniture::mountType.walmart_attribute_doc: Mount Type ==> How the item is attached. Used for products such as shelving and fixture hardware.

Furniture::assembledProductLength\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductLength\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductWidth\/measur.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductWidth\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductHeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::assembledProductWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Furniture::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

Furniture::variantAttributeNames\/varian.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Furniture::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Furniture::isProp65WarningRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Furniture::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Furniture::requiresTextileActLabeling.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

Furniture::countryOfOriginTextiles.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

Furniture::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Furniture::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Furniture::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Furniture::isLightingFactsLabelRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Lighting Facts Label Required ==> Does your item require a Lighting Facts label? A Lighting Facts label must appear on packaging for most general service "lamps" with medium screw bases. That includes most incandescent, compact fluorescent (CFL), and light emitting diode (LED) light bulbs. For more information on what items are covered, see 16 CFR § 305.2 and § 305.3.

Furniture::lightingFactsLabel.walmart_attribute_doc: Lighting Facts Label Image ==> URL of the location of the label. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// Label must include brightness specified lumens, estimated energy cost per year, life, light appearance, scale, energy used, and special handling information needed for disposal, as outlined by the FTC. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

Furniture::isAssemblyRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

Furniture::assemblyInstructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.

Furniture::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Furniture::fabricCareInstructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

Furniture::fabricColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Color ==> Color of a fabric part of an item, to distinguish it from the general color of the item, if needed.

Furniture::accentColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Accent Color ==> A secondary product color.

Furniture::cushionColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Cushion Color ==> Color of the cushion portion of an item, as distinguished from the main color of the rest of the item.

Furniture::recommendedUses.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Use ==> Further clarification of what the item may be used for. This improves searchability when customers search for general terms like "birthday party" that do not include the names of specific items.

Furniture::recommendedRooms.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Rooms ==> The rooms where the item is likely or recommended to be used.

Furniture::recommendedLocations.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Location ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.

Furniture::mattressFirmness.walmart_attribute_doc: Mattress Firmness ==> The mattresses level of firmness.

Furniture::mattressThickness\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Mattress Thickness ==> The mattresses thickness/height in inches.

Furniture::mattressThickness\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Mattress Thickness ==> The mattresses thickness/height in inches.

Furniture::pumpIncluded.walmart_attribute_doc: Pump Included ==> Is a pump included with the mattress?

Furniture::fillMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Fill Material ==> The material used to stuff the item (in a cushion or plush toy, for example).

Furniture::frameMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Frame Material ==> The material used in the item's frame if different than its main material makeup, which is described using the "Material" attribute.

Furniture::seatMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Material ==> The seat material if different than the item's main material makeup, which is described using the "Material" attribute.

Furniture::seatHeight\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Height ==> The height from the floor to the top of the seat, in inches.

Furniture::seatHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Height ==> The height from the floor to the top of the seat, in inches.

Furniture::seatBackHeight\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Back Height ==> The seat back height from the base of the seat to the top of the back, in inches.

Furniture::seatBackHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Back Height ==> The seat back height from the base of the seat to the top of the back, in inches.

Furniture::tableHeight\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Table Height ==> Height of a table, if it needs to be distinguished from other items in a set.

Furniture::tableHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Table Height ==> Height of a table, if it needs to be distinguished from other items in a set.

Furniture::topMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Top Material ==> Material of a top component of an item, if it needs to be distinguished from the rest of the components.

Furniture::topDimensions.walmart_attribute_doc: Top Dimensions ==> Dimensions of the top component of an item, such as a table.

Furniture::topFinish.walmart_attribute_doc: Top Finish ==> Finish of the top of a table, if it needs to be distinguished from other components.

Furniture::hardwareFinish.walmart_attribute_doc: Hardware Finish ==> If item has a hardware component, the surface treatment of that component. For example if the item was a dresser and had hardware drawer pulls with a brushed copper finish

Furniture::baseMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Base Material ==> Material of the base of an item (such as a pedestal table), if the base material needs to be distinguished from the rest of the item.

Furniture::baseColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Base Color ==> Color of the base portion of the item, if it needs to be distinguished from other components.

Furniture::baseFinish.walmart_attribute_doc: Base Finish ==> The finish of a base component of an item, if it needs to be distinguished from another component.

Furniture::doorOpeningStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Door Opening Style ==> The type of door-opening motion.

Furniture::doorStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Door Style ==> Descriptive term referring to the overall appearance or design of a door or doors as a component of an item such as the doors of cabinets, vanities, and storage sheds.

Furniture::slatWidth\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Slat Width ==> The width of a slat component of a product, such as widow blinds. This measurement is distinguished from the width of the product itself.

Furniture::slatWidth\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Slat Width ==> The width of a slat component of a product, such as widow blinds. This measurement is distinguished from the width of the product itself.

Furniture::numberOfHooks.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Hooks ==> The number of hooks on a coat & hat rack.

Furniture::headboardStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Headboard Style ==> Describes the design, overall style, and major features of a bed's headboard.

Furniture::frameColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Frame Color ==> The color of a frame component of a product, if it needs to be distinguished from other components.

Furniture::isAntique.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Antique ==> Is the item a valuable collectable because of its age?

Furniture::isFoldable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Foldable ==> Indicates that an item can be folded.

Furniture::isInflatable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Inflatable ==> Indicates that an item can be inflated.

Furniture::isWheeled.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Wheeled ==> Indicates that an item has wheels and can be rolled.

Furniture::isIndustrial.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Industrial ==> Indicates that an item can be used in an industrial setting or has an industrial application.

Furniture::isPowered.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).

Furniture::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

Furniture::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

Furniture::globalBrandLicense.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

Furniture::sportsLeague.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Furniture::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Furniture::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

Furniture::autographedBy.walmart_attribute_doc: Autographed by ==> The full name of the person who has autographed this copy.

Furniture::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Furniture::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Furniture::numberOfPanels.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Panels ==> The number of panels the product has as in room dividers and fireplace screens.

Furniture::seatBackStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Back Style ==> Descriptive term for the pattern or form of a seat back component.

GardenAndPatio\/GrillsAndOutdoorCooking:.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.

Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.
Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.
Is Bulk ==> Intended for weighable or variably 'sized' items where Vendor Pack Quantity (an integer value) is not all that helpful, for things like Fabric or Roving.

Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. Recommended Use ==> Further clarification of what the item may be used for. This improves searchability when customers search for general terms like "birthday party" that do not include the names of specific items.
Recommended Locations ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.
Frame Material ==> The material used in the item's frame if different than its main material makeup, which is described using the "Material" attribute.
Is Foldable ==> Indicates that an item can be folded.
Is Wheeled ==> Indicates that an item has wheels and can be rolled.
Is Weather-Resistant ==> Y indicates that the item has been made or is marketed as being resistant to elements of weather, such as rain, wind or cold.
Is Waterproof ==> Y indicates that the item has been especially made to be resistant to water, to some degree.
Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.
Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.
Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.
BTU ==> Indicates British thermal units for heating and cooling appliances.

Flavor ==> The distinctive taste or flavor of the item, as provided by manufacturer. This is used for a wide variety of products, including food and beverages for both animals and humans. This may also apply to non-food items that come in flavors, including dental products, cigars and smoker wood chips.
Lifespan ==> Amount of time the product is expected to last, as specified by the manufacturer. Important selection criteria for comparing products such as light bulbs.
Fuel Type ==> The kind of material that a product consumes to produce heat or power. Attribute is also used to classify a fuel product.
Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.
Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.
Installation Type ==> Term describing the setting necessary to make an item ready to be used. For example, a grill that is designed for a built-in type installation.
Age Group ==> General grouping of ages into commonly used demographic labels.
Home Decor Style ==> Describes home furnishings and decorations according to various themes, styles and tastes.
Is Industrial ==> Indicates that an item can be used in an industrial setting or has an industrial application.
Is Energy Star-Certified ==> Indicate Y if the product has been certified by the EPA Energy Star program.

Has Radiant Heat ==> Y indicates this item generates infrared heat as a feature. For example, outdoor grills that have an infrared unit that is designed to keep food juicer and provide more temperature control as compared with charcoal.
Flow Rate ==> Measurement of the volume of liquid per unit of time, intended for products like pumps, sprayers, showerheads, and irrigation regulators. Measured in gallons per minute.
Flow Rate ==> Measurement of the volume of liquid per unit of time, intended for products like pumps, sprayers, showerheads, and irrigation regulators. Measured in gallons per minute.

Has Automatic Shutoff ==> Y indicates the item has a mechanism that automatically shuts off the device or shuts off flow to the device. This is important to consumers to conserve resources or as a safety feature. It is used for a variety of products including hoses, appliances and gas grills.
Capacity ==> A product's available space. Capacity is often provided for items that contain multiple pieces of something or that can accommodate some number of objects.
Product Volume ==> The amount of material in the item’s package, expressed as a volume measurement. Important selection factor for items sold by volume such as bags of potting soil.
Cleaning, Care & Maintenance ==> Description of how the item should be cleaned and maintained.
Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)
Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.
Swatch Variant Attribute ==> Conditionally Required

GardenAndPatio::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

GardenAndPatio::keyFeatures/keyFeaturesV.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

GardenAndPatio::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

GardenAndPatio::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

GardenAndPatio::manufacturerPartNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

GardenAndPatio::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

GardenAndPatio::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

GardenAndPatio::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

GardenAndPatio::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

GardenAndPatio::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

GardenAndPatio::requiresTextileActLabeli.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

GardenAndPatio::countryOfOriginTextiles.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

GardenAndPatio::isLightingFactsLabelRequ.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Lighting Facts Label Required ==> Does your item require a Lighting Facts label? A Lighting Facts label must appear on packaging for most general service "lamps" with medium screw bases. That includes most incandescent, compact fluorescent (CFL), and light emitting diode (LED) light bulbs. For more information on what items are covered, see 16 CFR § 305.2 and § 305.3.

GardenAndPatio::isTearResistant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Tear-Resistant ==> Selecting Y indicates the item has a material that is specifically designed or treated to withstand the effects of tearing. GardenAndPatio::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

GardenAndPatio::lightBulbType.walmart_attribute_doc: Light Bulb Type ==> Category of light bulb based on method to produce the light. Important to consumers because each type has different characteristics including bulb life, energy efficiency and color temperature. For example LED bulbs have a greater bulb life than equivalent incandescent bulbs.

GardenAndPatio::lightBulbColor.walmart_attribute_doc: Light Bulb Color ==> Color of the bulb, if it needs to be differentiated from a standard light bulb.

GardenAndPatio::volts\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Volts ==> Number of volts the product produces or requires. The significance of voltage varies with type of product. For example, if product is an appliance, used to describe the outlet voltage required. If an item (such as a power supply) both produces and requires different voltages, each type of voltage should be included.

GardenAndPatio::watts\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Watts ==> Number of watts (wattage) of electrical power the product produces or consumes. This attribute is used in a wide variety of products including appliances, light bulbs, electronic equipment and electrical components.
