SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::variantGrou.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::variantAttr.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isPrimaryVa.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isProp65War.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::prop65Warni.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::smallPartsW.walmart_attribute_doc: Small Parts Warning Code ==> To determine if any choking warnings are applicable, check current product packaging for choking warning message(s). Please indicate the warning number (0-6). 0 - No warning applicable; 1 - Choking hazard is a small ball; 2 - Choking hazard contains small ball; 3 - Choking hazard contains small parts; 4 - Choking hazard balloon; 5 - Choking hazard is a marble; 6 - Choking hazard contains a marble.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::batteryTech.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::batteryTech.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::hasExpirati.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::shelfLife\/.walmart_attribute_doc: Shelf Life ==> The length of time that the product can be stored without becoming unfit for consumption or after which the product is no longer at best quality, measured in days.
Shelf Life ==> The length of time that the product can be stored without becoming unfit for consumption or after which the product is no longer at best quality, measured in days.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::requiresTex.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::countryOfOr.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::warrantyTex.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::fabricConte.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::fabricCareI.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isAssemblyR.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::assemblyIns.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::dexterity.walmart_attribute_doc: Dexterity ==> Indicates whether the item is designed to be used by the right or left hand.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::globalBrand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::sportsLeagu.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::pattern.walmart_attribute_doc: Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::finish.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::shape.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::season.walmart_attribute_doc: Season ==> If designed to be used during a specific type of year, the appropriate season this item may be used.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::capacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Capacity ==> A product's available space. Capacity is often provided for items that contain multiple pieces of something or that can accommodate some number of objects.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::seatingCapa.walmart_attribute_doc: Seating Capacity ==> The number of people that can be accommodated by the available seats of an item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::maximumWeig.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::wirelessTec.walmart_attribute_doc: Wireless Technologies ==> Any wireless communications standard used within or by the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isPortable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Portable ==> Is the item designed to be easily moved?

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isFoldable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Foldable ==> Indicates that an item can be folded.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isWeatherRe.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Weather-Resistant ==> Y indicates that the item has been made or is marketed as being resistant to elements of weather, such as rain, wind or cold.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isWaterproo.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Waterproof ==> Y indicates that the item has been especially made to be resistant to water, to some degree.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::isPowered.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::horsepower\.walmart_attribute_doc: Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). Horsepower is also used as common rating on electric motors and products that contain them.

Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::tireDiamete.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Diameter ==> The size (diameter) of the wheel rim that the tire is designed to fit. Measured in inches: 17; 22

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::cleaningCar.walmart_attribute_doc: Cleaning, Care & Maintenance ==> Description of how the item should be cleaned and maintained.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::recommended.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Use ==> Further clarification of what the item may be used for. This improves searchability when customers search for general terms like "birthday party" that do not include the names of specific items.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::lockType.walmart_attribute_doc: Lock Type ==> The type of lock included with the device. Typically based on access mechanism. Example: electronic lock, padlock

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::lockingMech.walmart_attribute_doc: Locking Mechanism ==> Type of internal mechanism that locks the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::recommended.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Locations ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.

SportAndRecreation\/Cycling::lightBulbTy.walmart_attribute_doc: Light Bulb Type ==> Category of light bulb based on method to produce the light. For example LED bulbs have a greater bulb life than equivalent incandescent bulbs.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::shortDescri.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::keyFeatures.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::manufacture.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::multipackQu.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::warrantyTex.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::hasFuelCont.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::dexterity.walmart_attribute_doc: Dexterity ==> Indicates whether the item is designed to be used by the right or left hand.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::globalBrand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isAssemblyR.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::assemblyIns.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::firearmCham.walmart_attribute_doc: Firearm Chamber Length ==> The measurement of the location in a gun where the ammunition cartridge is contained, typically in inches.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::sportsLeagu.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::pattern.walmart_attribute_doc: Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::finish.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::shape.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::season.walmart_attribute_doc: Season ==> If designed to be used during a specific type of year, the appropriate season this item may be used.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::bladeType.walmart_attribute_doc: Blade Type ==> The style and shape of the cutting edge of knife, saw, or tool. Alternatively, the shape of the wide, flat portion of an oar or propeller.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::animalType.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Type ==> The common generic name for the type of animal.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::wirelessTec.walmart_attribute_doc: Wireless Technologies ==> Any wireless communications standard used within or by the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isMemorabil.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Memorabilia ==> Is this a noteworthy item collected for historical interest?

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isCollectib.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Collectible ==> Indicates if the item is regarded as being of value or interest to a collector.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isPortable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Portable ==> Is the item designed to be easily moved?

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isWeatherRe.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Weather-Resistant ==> Y indicates that the item has been made or is marketed as being resistant to elements of weather, such as rain, wind or cold.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isWaterproo.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Waterproof ==> Y indicates that the item has been especially made to be resistant to water, to some degree.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::isPowered.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::compatibleD.walmart_attribute_doc: Compatible Devices ==> A list of the devices compatible with the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::cleaningCar.walmart_attribute_doc: Cleaning, Care & Maintenance ==> Description of how the item should be cleaned and maintained.

SportAndRecreation\/Weapons::recommended.walmart_attribute_doc: Recommended Use ==> Further clarification of what the item may be used for. This improves searchability when customers search for general terms like "birthday party" that do not include the names of specific items.
Recommended Locations ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::shortDescrip.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::keyFeatures/.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::multipackQua.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::productSecon.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::gender.walmart_attribute_doc: Gender ==> Indicate whether this item is meant for a particular gender or meant to be gender-agnostic (unisex).

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::size.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::ageGroup\/ag.walmart_attribute_doc: Age Group ==> General grouping of ages into commonly used demographic labels.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::ageRange.walmart_attribute_doc: Age Range ==> Minimum and Maximum Ages for a product. Note: Both Min. and Max. attributes will be the same Unit of Measure: Months, or Years.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::digitalZoom.walmart_attribute_doc: Digital Zoom ==> Measure of the magnification power provided by a feature that electronically enlarges the image area at the center of the frame, trims away the outside edges of the picture, and interpolates the result to the pixel dimensions of the original. Important to consumers because digital zoom reduces the image resolution and the image quality vs. optical zoom, which does not affect the quality of the zoomed image.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::opticalZoom.walmart_attribute_doc: Optical Zoom ==> Measure of the magnification power of a physical optical zoom lens. For example, a camera with an optical zoom of 4x allows the users to magnify image up to 4x larger. Important to consumers because optical zoom results in better image quality than zoom that is digitally generated.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::lensDiameter.walmart_attribute_doc: Lens Diameter ==> Measurement of the diameter of the front portion of the lens, measured in mm. For cameras, important factor to fit accessories such as filters.
Lens Diameter ==> Measurement of the diameter of the front portion of the lens, measured in mm. For cameras, important factor to fit accessories such as filters.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::lensCoating.walmart_attribute_doc: Lens Coating ==> Type of thin layer of material applied to the surface of lenses or other optical elements that provide specific effects. Usually applied to components such as camera lenses to improve resistance to scratches, or provide a mirror effect for sunglasses.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::sensorResolu.walmart_attribute_doc: Sensor Resolution ==> One specification describing the smallest detectable incremental change of input parameter that can be detected in the output signal. Expressed either as a proportion of the full-scale reading, or as an absolute. Used for a variety of sensor types and importance varies with product. For example for digital cameras, image sensor resolution is an important factor for image quality.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::magnificatio.walmart_attribute_doc: Magnification ==> Number expressing a ratio of how much a device’s optical system can increase (or decrease) an image as compared to the true size. Typically applied to products such as magnifying lenses and microscopes and expressed as a number followed by an x.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::focusType.walmart_attribute_doc: Focus Type ==> Terms that describe modes, mechanisms, or control arrangements that adjust optical focus on the device. For example, if item is a pair of binoculars, focus type would describe weather the lenses on binoculars can be adjusted independently of one another.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::fieldOfView.walmart_attribute_doc: Field of View ==> Measure of the area that can be seen through a lens of an item, as specified by the manufacturer. Attribute applied to such products as microscopes, telescopes and rifle scopes. Can be expressed as the angular field of view (in degrees) or the true field of view (in feet).

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isParfocal.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Parfocal ==> Y indicates the item has a lens that stays in focus when magnification/focal length is changed. For example, a microscope that stays in focus when the microscope objective is rotated.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::focalRatio.walmart_attribute_doc: Focal Ratio ==> Ratio of the lens's focal length, to the diameter of the entrance pupil (optical image of the physical aperture stop, as 'seen' through the front of the lens system). Also known as the f-number or f-stop, this number indicates lens speed, an important selection criteria based on intended photographic use.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::displayTechn.walmart_attribute_doc: Display Technology ==> The primary technology used for the item's display.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::displayResol.walmart_attribute_doc: Display Resolution ==> If the item has a screen display, the resolution value of the screen component of the product. Typically measured as the number of pixels creating the display expressed as number of columns x number of rows. For example, a digital camera's screen resolution (vs. the image quality the camera can produce) of 640x480.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::hasNightVisi.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Night Vision ==> Does this device have features that give users the ability to see in low light conditions?

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::assembledPro.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::variantGroup.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::variantAttri.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isPrimaryVar.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isProp65Warn.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::prop65Warnin.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::batteryTechn.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isChemical.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Chemical ==> ‘Chemical’ is defined by Walmart to include any item of Merchandise that contains a powder, gel, paste, or liquid that is not intended for human consumption. ‘Chemical’ also includes the following types items that ARE intended for human consumption, inhalation, or absorption, or labeled with drug facts: All over-the-counter medications, including: Lozenges, pills or capsules (e.g. pain relievers; allergy medications; as well as vitamins and supplements that contain metals); Medicated swabs and wipes, acne medication, and sunscreen; Medicated patches (such as nicotine patches); Liquids (e.g. cough medicine, medicated drops, nasal spray and inhalers); Medicated shampoos, gums, ointments and creams; Medicated lip balm, lip creams and petroleum jelly; Contraceptive foam, films, and spermicides; and Product/Equipment sold with chemicals (e.g. vaporizer sold with medication) and electronic cigarettes. If your product meets this definition, Mark Y and ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isMulticoate.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Multicoated ==> Y indicates the item has a series of layers of coatings; For example, eye glasses that have layers of anti-reflective coatings.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isLockable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Lockable ==> Y indicates the item has the capability to be secured by a lock or a locking mechanism. Differentiates lockability as a feature of items such as a tool boxes, microscopes, or saddlebags.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::lockType.walmart_attribute_doc: Lock Type ==> The type of lock included with the device. Typically based on access mechanism. Example: electronic lock, padlock

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::hasMemoryCar.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Memory Card Slot ==> Y indicates the item has a place to insert electronic memory data storage device used to record digital information.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::isFogResista.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Fog-Resistant ==> Has this product been treated to prevent the condensation of water on its surface?

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::operatingTem.walmart_attribute_doc: Operating Temperature ==> Temperature at which an electrical or mechanical device operates.
Operating Temperature ==> Temperature at which an electrical or mechanical device operates.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::hasDovetailB.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Dovetail Bar System ==> Does this have a dovetail bar used to attach a telescope optical tube to a mount? Typical styles include Losmandy D and Vixen V.

SportAndRecreation\/Optics::attachmentSt.walmart_attribute_doc: Attachment Style ==> Description of how the product is able to attach to other surfaces or items. Also used for product fit. For example, bayonet is an attachment style describing how a camera lens attaches to the camera body

Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.
Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Color Category ==> Select the color from a short list that best describes the general color of the item. This improves searchability as it allows customers to view items by color from the left navigation when they perform a search.
Sport ==> If the product is sports-related, the name of the specific sport depicted on the product, or the target sport for the product use
Gender ==> Indicate whether this item is meant for a particular gender or meant to be gender-agnostic (unisex).
Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.
Age Group ==> General grouping of ages into commonly used demographic labels.
Age Range ==> Minimum and Maximum Ages for a product. Note: Both Min. and Max. attributes will be the same Unit of Measure: Months, or Years.

Clothing Size ==> Clothing size as it appears on the garment label. Use this attribute for general sizes (S, M, L) as well as general numbered sizes (2, 4, 6, etc). For items that have unique sizes (dress shirts, bras, etc.) use the specific size attribute.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.
Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Small Parts Warning Code ==> To determine if any choking warnings are applicable, check current product packaging for choking warning message(s). Please indicate the warning number (0-6). 0 - No warning applicable; 1 - Choking hazard is a small ball; 2 - Choking hazard contains small ball; 3 - Choking hazard contains small parts; 4 - Choking hazard balloon; 5 - Choking hazard is a marble; 6 - Choking hazard contains a marble.

Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
SportAndRecreation\/SportAndRecreationOt.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

SportAndRecreation\/SportAndRecreationOt.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Expiration ==> Select Yes if product is labeled with any type of expiration or code date that indicates when product should no longer be consumed or no longer at best quality (e.g. Best If Used By, Best By, Use By, etc. ). Some examples of items with expiration dates include food, cleaning supplies, beauty products, etc.
Shelf Life ==> The length of time that the product can be stored without becoming unfit for consumption or after which the product is no longer at best quality, measured in days.
Shelf Life ==> The length of time that the product can be stored without becoming unfit for consumption or after which the product is no longer at best quality, measured in days.

Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.
Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Composite Wood Certification Code ==> Composite Wood - Indicates if any portion of the item contains any of the following types of composite wood: hardwood plywood veneer core, hardwood plywood composite core, particleboard, or medium density fiber board (MDF). Enter the code corresponding to the highest formaldehyde emission level on any portion of the item. Code Definitions: 1 - Does not contain composite wood; 7 - Product is not CARB compliant and cannot be sold in California; 8 - Product is CARB compliant and can be sold in California.
Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.
Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)
Shoe Size ==> The alphanumeric representation of the size of the shoe, as issued by the manufacturer.

Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.
Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.
Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.
Drive System ==> Refers to the position of drive system for machines.
Stride Length ==> A stride length is the distance between feet when walking or stepping. Especially useful for exercise equipment.

Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.
Dexterity ==> Indicates whether the item is designed to be used by the right or left hand.
Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)
Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.
Autographed by ==> The full name of the person who has autographed this copy.
Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.
Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.
Pattern ==> Decorative design or visual ornamentation, often with a thematic, recurring motif.

Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.
Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.
Season ==> If designed to be used during a specific type of year, the appropriate season this item may be used.
Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.
Capacity ==> A product's available space. Capacity is often provided for items that contain multiple pieces of something or that can accommodate some number of objects.
Seating Capacity ==> The number of people that can be accommodated by the available seats of an item.

Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.
Maximum Incline ==> Indicates the highest slope that the equipment can simulate, as a percentage. Most treadmill machines do not go beyond a 15 percent grade.
Bat Drop ==> The difference when the weight in ounces is subtracted from the length in inches.
Fitness Goal ==> General objectives a person might use this product to achieve.
Football Size ==> General terms used to indicate the circumference and weight of footballs, according to US standards.

Basketball Size ==> A number that signifies the circumference and approximate weight of basketballs according to common standards. 1 indicates the ball is a micro-mini with a circumference of 16". 3 indicates the ball is a mini with a circumference of 22". 4 indicates the ball is for younger children (ages 5-8) with a circumference of 25.5". 5 indicates the ball is for youth with a circumference of 27.5". 6 indicates the ball is for adult women with a circumference of 28.5". 7 indicates the ball is for adult men, with a circumference of 29.5".

Soccer Ball Size ==> A number signifying the size of the ball, in accordance with international standards. 1 indicates the ball is 18"-20" and intended for small children. 2 indicates the ball is 20"-22" and intended for small children. 3 indicates the ball is 23"-24" and intended for children under 8. 4 indicates the ball is 25"-26" and intended for children ages 8-12. 5 indicates the ball is 27"-28" and intended for adult use.
Ball Core Material ==> The primary medium that composes the central core of a ball, affecting its weight and bounce.
Blade Type ==> The style and shape of the cutting edge of knife, saw, or tool. Alternatively, the shape of the wide, flat portion of an oar or propeller.
Animal Type ==> The common generic name for the type of animal.
Tent Type ==> Describes the purpose, structure, or style of portable cloth shelters.
Fishing Location ==> Indicates the ideal water salinity or place for this item's use.
Fishing Line Pound Test ==> The strength of a fishing line, measured in pounds. This is used to select the best line based on the weight of the fish.
Wireless Technologies ==> Any wireless communications standard used within or by the item.

Has Automatic Shutoff ==> Y indicates the item has a mechanism that automatically shuts off the device or shuts off flow to the device. This is important to consumers to conserve resources or as a safety feature. It is used for a variety of products including hoses, appliances and gas grills.
Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.
Minimum Temperature ==> The lower temperature limit or capability of an item such as a thermometer or chillers.
Is Memorabilia ==> Is this a noteworthy item collected for historical interest?
Is Collectible ==> Indicates if the item is regarded as being of value or interest to a collector.
Is Portable ==> Is the item designed to be easily moved?
Is Foldable ==> Indicates that an item can be folded.
Is Space-Saving ==> Does this item have properties designed to reduce its overall size or to fit in underutilized spaces?
Is Wheeled ==> Indicates that an item has wheels and can be rolled.

Is Tear-Resistant ==> Selecting Y indicates the item has a material that is specifically designed or treated to withstand the effects of tearing. Important to consumers for a wide variety of products including mailing envelopes, garbage bags and pet bed covers.
Is Weather-Resistant ==> Y indicates that the item has been made or is marketed as being resistant to elements of weather, such as rain, wind or cold.
Is Waterproof ==> Y indicates that the item has been especially made to be resistant to water, to some degree.
Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).
Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). Horsepower is also used as common rating on electric motors and products that contain them.

Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). Horsepower is also used as common rating on electric motors and products that contain them.
Bullet Velocity ==> The bullet velocity, usually measured in feet per second.
Bullet Velocity ==> The bullet velocity, usually measured in feet per second.
Tire Diameter ==> The size (diameter) of the wheel rim that the tire is designed to fit. Measured in inches: 17; 22
Tire Diameter ==> The size (diameter) of the wheel rim that the tire is designed to fit. Measured in inches: 17; 22
Cleaning, Care & Maintenance ==> Description of how the item should be cleaned and maintained.

Recommended Use ==> Further clarification of what the item may be used for. This improves searchability when customers search for general terms like "birthday party" that do not include the names of specific items.
Recommended Locations ==> The primary location recommended for the item's use.
Compatible Devices ==> A list of the devices compatible with the item.
Swatch Variant Attribute ==> Conditionally Required
Swatch Image URL ==> Conditionally Required

ToysCategory\/Toys::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

ToysCategory\/Toys::keyFeatures/keyFeatu.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

ToysCategory\/Toys::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

ToysCategory\/Toys::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

ToysCategory\/Toys::manufacturerPartNumb.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

ToysCategory\/Toys::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

ToysCategory\/Toys::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

ToysCategory\/Toys::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

ToysCategory\/Toys::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

ToysCategory\/Toys::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

ToysCategory\/Toys::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

ToysCategory\/Toys::productSecondaryImag.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

ToysCategory\/Toys::targetAudience.walmart_attribute_doc: Target Audience ==> The demographic for which the item is targeted.

ToysCategory\/Toys::educationalFocus.walmart_attribute_doc: Educational Focus ==> Is the item intended to improve a particular educational skill?

ToysCategory\/Toys::skillLevel.walmart_attribute_doc: Skill Level ==> Is the product marketed or intended to be used by someone with a particular background or skill level?

ToysCategory\/Toys::awardsWon.walmart_attribute_doc: Awards Won ==> Use this attribute if the item has won any awards in its particular product category.

ToysCategory\/Toys::theme.walmart_attribute_doc: Theme ==> A dominant idea, meaning, or setting applied to an item. Used in a wide range of products including decorative objects, clothing, toys, and furniture. Can be an important selection criteria for consumers who want to achieve a particular ambiance for room décor or for a special occasion.

ToysCategory\/Toys::character.walmart_attribute_doc: Character ==> A person or entity portrayed in print or visual media. A character might be a fictional personality or an actual living person.

ToysCategory\/Toys::activity.walmart_attribute_doc: Activity ==> The general type of activity one might perform while wearing this garment.

ToysCategory\/Toys::globalBrandLicense.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand License ==> A brand name that is not owned by the product brand, but is licensed for the particular product. (Often character and media tie-ins and promotions.)

ToysCategory\/Toys::numberOfPlayers.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Players ==> Number of players that can participate in the game.

ToysCategory\/Toys::ingredientListImage.walmart_attribute_doc: Ingredient List Image ==> If your product contains a list of ingredients OTHER than that required with drug, supplement, or nutrition info, provide the URL of image. Provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB.

ToysCategory\/Toys::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

ToysCategory\/Toys::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

ToysCategory\/Toys::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

ToysCategory\/Toys::requiresTextileActLa.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

ToysCategory\/Toys::countryOfOriginTexti.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

ToysCategory\/Toys::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

ToysCategory\/Toys::fabricCareInstructio.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

ToysCategory\/Toys::isAssemblyRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Assembly Required ==> Is product unassembled and must be put together before use?

ToysCategory\/Toys::assemblyInstructions.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembly Instructions ==> Provide a URL to an image or PDF asset showing assembly instructions for items requiring assembly. URLs must be static and have no query parameters. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// and should end in in the file name.

ToysCategory\/Toys::material.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

ToysCategory\/Toys::finish.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

ToysCategory\/Toys::shape.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

ToysCategory\/Toys::occasion.walmart_attribute_doc: Occasion ==> The particular target time, event, or holiday for the product.

ToysCategory\/Toys::sport.walmart_attribute_doc: Sport ==> If the product is sports-related, the name of the specific sport depicted on the product, or the target sport for the product use

ToysCategory\/Toys::hairColorCategory.walmart_attribute_doc: Hair Color Category ==> Term for a basic color of human hair. Used both to describe a group of hair color dyes and to describe a component part of an item such as a doll's hair color. Values do not include "Brunette" because it is not a color, but describes a person with dark brown hair. Non-Natural would include colors like pink, green, and purple.

ToysCategory\/Toys::skinTone.walmart_attribute_doc: Skin Tone ==> Color of skin that a product is targeted for, if labeled on the product. Note: This is distinct from the color of the product. "Light Beige" may be a color, while "Fair" may be a skin tone.

ToysCategory\/Toys::flavor.walmart_attribute_doc: Flavor ==> The distinctive taste or flavor of the item, as provided by manufacturer. This is used for a wide variety of products, including food and beverages for both animals and humans. This may also apply to non-food items that come in flavors, including dental products, cigars and smoker wood chips.

ToysCategory\/Toys::animalType.walmart_attribute_doc: Animal Type ==> The common generic name for the type of animal.

ToysCategory\/Toys::vehicleType.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Category ==> Grouping of different kinds of vehicles based on use and form. Important selection criteria, especially for compatibility, for products including boat components, tires and auto accessories. Vehicle Type also used for toys such as model rocket ships and remote-controlled race cars.

ToysCategory\/Toys::displayTechnology.walmart_attribute_doc: Display Technology ==> The primary technology used for the item's display.

ToysCategory\/Toys::screenSize\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Screen Size ==> Typically measured on the diagonal in inches.

ToysCategory\/Toys::screenSize\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Screen Size ==> Typically measured on the diagonal in inches.

ToysCategory\/Toys::isPowered.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).

ToysCategory\/Toys::powerType.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

ToysCategory\/Toys::capacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Capacity ==> A product's available space. Capacity is often provided for items that contain multiple pieces of something or that can accommodate some number of objects.

ToysCategory\/Toys::seatingCapacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Seating Capacity ==> The number of people that can be accommodated by the available seats of an item.

ToysCategory\/Toys::minimumWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Weight ==> The lower weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Maximum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Maximum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

ToysCategory\/Toys::minimumWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Minimum Weight ==> The lower weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Maximum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Maximum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

ToysCategory\/Toys::maximumWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

ToysCategory\/Toys::maximumWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Weight ==> The upper weight limit or capability of an item, often used in conjunction with "Minimum Weight". The meaning varies with context of product. For example, when used with "Minimum Weight", this attribute provides weight ranges for a range of products including pet medicine, baby carriers and outdoor play structures.

ToysCategory\/Toys::maximumSpeed\/measur.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Speed ==> The maximum speed at which the item operates.	Important safety factor when applied to toys such as ride-able and remote-controlled vehicles.

ToysCategory\/Toys::maximumSpeed\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Speed ==> The maximum speed at which the item operates.	Important safety factor when applied to toys such as ride-able and remote-controlled vehicles.

ToysCategory\/Toys::isTravelSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Travel Size ==> Please indicate whether the product is a smaller version of a larger-sized product.

ToysCategory\/Toys::isInflatable.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Inflatable ==> Indicates that an item can be inflated.

ToysCategory\/Toys::fillMaterial.walmart_attribute_doc: Fill Material ==> The material used to stuff the item (in a cushion or plush toy, for example).

ToysCategory\/Toys::makesNoise.walmart_attribute_doc: Makes Noise ==> Indicates that the item has a noise-making feature. For example, a toy lawn mower that makes roaring-engine sounds.

ToysCategory\/Toys::sportsLeague.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.
