ToysCategory\/Toys::sportsTeam.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

ToysCategory\/Toys::athlete.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

ToysCategory\/Toys::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

ToysCategory\/Toys::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Vehicle\/Tires::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Vehicle\/Tires::keyFeatures/keyFeaturesV.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Vehicle\/Tires::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Vehicle\/Tires::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Vehicle\/Tires::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/Tires::manufacturerPartNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/Tires::multipackQuantity.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Vehicle\/Tires::countPerPack.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Vehicle\/Tires::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Vehicle\/Tires::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/Tires::productSecondaryImageURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/Tires::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireSize.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Size ==> The tire industry's standardized sizing information for the tire.

Vehicle\/Tires::vehicleClassDesignator.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Class Designator ==> The letter or letters indicating the intended use or vehicle class for the tire, as specified by the manufacturer.Typically used as part of the ISO tire code printed on the tire. For example, tires that have a designation of T (Temporary) means the tire has been designed for restricted usage for space-saver type spare wheels.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireWidth.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Width ==> The tire's section width as measured from its inner sidewall to its outer sidewall at the widest point. Measured in millimeters: 209mm; 222mm

Vehicle\/Tires::tireAspectRatio.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Aspect Ratio ==> Number describing the tire’s profile and is the ratio of sidewall height as a percentage of the nominal section width of the tire, as specified by the manufacturer. Typically used as part of the ISO tire code printed on the tire. The higher the number, the taller the sidewall; the lower the number, the lower the sidewall. For example, 60 indicates that this tire size's sidewall height (from rim to tread) is 60% of its section width.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireSpeedRating.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Speed Rating ==> Rating system symbol that corresponds to a tire's maximum speed capability. For example, a speed rating of L corresponds to a maximum speed of 75mph.

Vehicle\/Tires::wheelDiameter.walmart_attribute_doc: Wheel Diameter ==> The size (diameter) of the wheel as measured in inches. If item is a tire, used for fitting tires and used as part of the ISO tire code printed on a vehicle tire. For example,16 indicates the wheel rim size the tire is designed to fit.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireLoadRange.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Load Range ==> The 'Load Range' letter on a light truck tire indicates its ply rating.

Vehicle\/Tires::overallDiameter\/measure.walmart_attribute_doc: Overall Diameter ==> Outer diameter of the tire measured in the center of the tread. This measurement is done according to industry standards (no load, mounted on measuring rim).

Vehicle\/Tires::overallDiameter\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Overall Diameter ==> Outer diameter of the tire measured in the center of the tread. This measurement is done according to industry standards (no load, mounted on measuring rim).

Vehicle\/Tires::tireSeason.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Season ==> Tire types designed to meet specific needs based on time of year and weather conditions.

Vehicle\/Tires::mudAndSnowRated.walmart_attribute_doc: Mud & Snow Rated ==> Y indicates the tire has been specially designed, manufactured and rated to be used in muddy or very snowy and cold conditions. Tires with this rating frequently have are marked with M+T or M&T.

Vehicle\/Tires::isRunFlat.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Run Flat ==> Entering a "Y" value signifies the tire is designed to resist the effects of deflation when punctured, and enables the vehicle to go at reduced speeds (under 3 mph (4.8 km/h)), and for limited distances (up to 10 mi (16 km).

Vehicle\/Tires::constructionType.walmart_attribute_doc: Construction Type ==> The term that describes type of internal construction of the tire.

Vehicle\/Tires::treadDepth.walmart_attribute_doc: Tread Depth ==> Vertical measurement between the top of the tread rubber to the bottom of the tire's deepest grooves tread depth, expressed in 32nds of an inch.

Vehicle\/Tires::treadWidth.walmart_attribute_doc: Tread Width ==> Measurement between the outer and inner edges of the tire's tread design as specified by the manufacturer. Usually this measurement approximates the width of the tread that comes into contact with the road.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireLoadIndex.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Load Index ==> Assigned numerical value that corresponds to the maximum amount of weight a tire can safely carry as shown on Tire Load Index charts. Example: The load index 90 has been assigned to a load carrying capacity of 1323 pounds.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireTreadwearRating.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Treadwear Rating ==> The numeric portion of the UTQG (Uniform Tire Quality Grade Standards) printed on the sidewall of the tire that signifies a tire's durability. The UTQG (Uniform Tire Quality Grade) system is a set of standards developed by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), which is part of the United States Department of Transportation (DOT). Higher tread wear numbers indicate that the tread of a tire should last longer. A control tire is assigned a grade of 100. Other tires are compared to the control tire. For example, a tire grade of 200 should wear twice as long as the control tire.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireTractionRating.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Traction Rating ==> Rating of a tire's ability to stop on wet surfaces, as specified by the manufacturer. Component of the UTQG (Uniform Tire Quality Grade) system is a set of standards developed by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), which is part of the United States Department of Transportation (DOT). The traction grades range from AA (highest) to C (lowest). A tire that is graded AA should stop better on wet surfaces than a tire with a lower grade.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireTemperatureRating.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Temperature Rating ==> Portion of the UTQG rating system that indicates a tire's resistance to heat and its ability to dissipate heat. The UTQG (Uniform Tire Quality Grade) system is a set of standards developed by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA), which is part of the United States Department of Transportation (DOT). The grades range from A (highest) to C (lowest). A tire that is graded A would run cooler than a tire with a lower grade.

Vehicle\/Tires::tireSidewallStyle.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Sidewall Style ==> The visual treatment of the outside of the sidewall of a tire. Can include solid color, colored stripes, or lettering.

Vehicle\/Tires::maximumInflationPressure.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Inflation Pressure ==> The highest "cold" inflation pressure that the tire is designed to contain as specified by the manufacturer. The maximum inflation pressure is branded on the tire in kilopascals (kPa) and pounds per square inch (psi).

Maximum Inflation Pressure ==> The highest "cold" inflation pressure that the tire is designed to contain as specified by the manufacturer. The maximum inflation pressure is branded on the tire in kilopascals (kPa) and pounds per square inch (psi).

Vehicle\/Tires::uniformTireQualityGrade.walmart_attribute_doc: Uniform Tire Quality Grade (UTQG) ==> The composite of three individual UTQG components of tire rating of tread wear, traction and temperature tolerance. Example format: 700 AA. These Uniform Tire Quality Grade Standards (UTQG) are administered by the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). Website: http://www.nhtsa.gov/

Vehicle\/Tires::tireType.walmart_attribute_doc: Tire Type ==> Category of vehicle tires based on use: Motorcycle Tire; Passenger Car Tire; Performance Tire

Vehicle\/Tires::assembledProductWeight\/.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/Tires::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

Vehicle\/Tires::variantAttributeNames\/v.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Vehicle\/Tires::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Vehicle\/Tires::isProp65WarningRequired.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Vehicle\/Tires::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Vehicle\/Tires::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Vehicle\/Tires::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Vehicle\/Tires::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Vehicle\/Tires::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Vehicle\/Tires::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::shortDescription.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::keyFeatures/keyFe.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::manufacturer.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::manufacturerPartN.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::modelNumber.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::mainImageUrl.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::productSecondaryI.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::vehicleType.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Category ==> Grouping of different kinds of vehicles based on use and form. Important selection criteria, especially for compatibility, for products including boat components, tires and auto accessories. Vehicle Type also used for toys such as model rocket ships and remote-controlled race cars.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::vehicleYear.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Year ==> The model year as provided by the manufacturer. If the product is a replacement part or accessory, this attribute is used to identify if a product fits a particular vehicle.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::vehicleMake.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Make ==> The manufacturer’s marque, under which the vehicle is produced and sold. For example, the Toyota Motor Corporation manufactures the vehicle makes of Toyota, Lexus and Scion. If the product is a replacement part or accessory, this attribute is used to identify if a product fits a particular vehicle.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::vehicleModel.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Model ==> The manufacturer’s name/letter/number designation given to a particular design or series of vehicles with similar characteristics. If the product is a replacement part or accessory, this attribute is used to identify if a product fits a particular vehicle.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::submodel.walmart_attribute_doc: Submodel ==> Any secondary designation of model for the product

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::powertrain.walmart_attribute_doc: Powertrain ==> Description of the main components that generate power and deliver it to the method of propulsion (to the road or water surface).

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::drivetrain.walmart_attribute_doc: Drivetrain ==> Terms describing the type of system in a motor vehicle that connects the transmission to the drive axels.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::transmissionDesig.walmart_attribute_doc: Transmission Designation ==> Terms or standard abbreviations describing the type of vehicle transmission, as specified by the manufacturer. For example, 6MT 4WD would be 6-speed manual transmission, 4-wheel drive.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::engineModel.walmart_attribute_doc: Engine Model ==> The manufacturer's name given to a particular design, product line, or series of engines with similar characteristics.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::engineDisplacemen.walmart_attribute_doc: Engine Displacement ==> The combined volume, as displaced by the pistons for all cylinders of an internal combustion engine. Generally expressed in cubic centimeters up to 1000 cc, and liters thereafter, or in cubic inches. Engine displacement is often used as a rough indicator of an engine's power and potential fuel consumption.

Engine Displacement ==> The combined volume, as displaced by the pistons for all cylinders of an internal combustion engine. Generally expressed in cubic centimeters up to 1000 cc, and liters thereafter, or in cubic inches. Engine displacement is often used as a rough indicator of an engine's power and potential fuel consumption.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::boreStroke.walmart_attribute_doc: Bore x Stroke ==> The ratio between the diameter of the cylinder and the stroke of the piston.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::inductionSystem.walmart_attribute_doc: Induction System ==> Method and mechanism used to meter and direct the flow of air into an engine.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::compressionRatio.walmart_attribute_doc: Compression Ratio ==> A value representing the ratio of the volume of the combustion chamber from its largest capacity to its smallest capacity. Important specification for many common combustion engines. A gasoline- powered engine typically has a compression ratio of 10:1.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::maximumEnginePowe.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Engine Power ==> The maximum power output of the engine as specified by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::torque.walmart_attribute_doc: Torque ==> Measurement of turning or twisting force as measured in foot pounds (ft-lbs). Significance varies with product. For example, for torque wrenches, torque value helps consumers select the correct torque wrench for tightening a specific nut or bolt. If item has an engine, torque is a general indicator of an engine's pulling power.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::acceleration.walmart_attribute_doc: Acceleration ==> The rate of change in velocity as a function of time it takes for the product to reach a specific velocity. For example, a vehicles’ acceleration is typically calculated when the car is not in motion (0 mph), until the amount of time it takes to reach a velocity of 60 miles per hour.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::topSpeed.walmart_attribute_doc: Top Speed ==> The maximum speed the product can attain

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::coolingSystem.walmart_attribute_doc: Cooling System ==> Method by which the engine is cooled

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::fuelRequirement.walmart_attribute_doc: Fuel Requirement ==> The type of fuel the product requires, as specified by the manufacturer. For example most land vehicles and watercraft require gasoline with a specific octane rating.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::fuelSystem.walmart_attribute_doc: Fuel System ==> Method and mechanisms used to deliver the flow of fuel into an engine. Independent of fuel type. For example, engines fueled by gasoline can have either a fuel injection or carbonated fuel system.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::fuelCapacity\/mea.walmart_attribute_doc: Fuel Capacity ==> Volume of fuel the item can hold.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::fuelCapacity\/uni.walmart_attribute_doc: Fuel Capacity ==> Volume of fuel the item can hold.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::averageFuelConsum.walmart_attribute_doc: Average Fuel Consumption ==> Amount of fuel used to cover a specific distance. For example, if a moped or boat motor uses an average of 12 gallons per mile, the value would be 12mpg
Average Fuel Consumption ==> Amount of fuel used to cover a specific distance. For example, if a moped or boat motor uses an average of 12 gallons per mile, the value would be 12mpg

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::frontSuspension.walmart_attribute_doc: Front Suspension ==> Terms describing type of suspension system including springs, shock absorbers and linkages that connects a vehicle to its front wheels.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::rearSuspension.walmart_attribute_doc: Rear Suspension ==> Terms describing type of suspension system including springs, shock absorbers and linkages that connects a vehicle to its rear wheels.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::frontBrakes.walmart_attribute_doc: Front Brakes ==> Terms describing the type of braking system including disks, master cylinder connection, and caliper mountings on the front wheels of the product.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::rearBrakes.walmart_attribute_doc: Rear Brakes ==> Terms describing the type of braking system including disks/drums, master cylinder connection, and caliper mountings on the rear wheels of the product.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::frontWheels.walmart_attribute_doc: Front Wheels ==> Dimensions and terms describing the wheels on the front of the product.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::rearWheels.walmart_attribute_doc: Rear Wheels ==> Dimensions and terms describing the rear wheels of the product

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::frontTires.walmart_attribute_doc: Front Tires ==> Dimensions of the tires on the front wheels of the product.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::rearTires.walmart_attribute_doc: Rear Tires ==> The dimensions of the tires on the rear wheels of the product.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::seatingCapacity.walmart_attribute_doc: Seating Capacity ==> The number of people that can be accommodated by the available seats of an item.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::seatHeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Height ==> The height from the floor to the top of the seat, in inches.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::seatHeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Seat Height ==> The height from the floor to the top of the seat, in inches.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::wheelbase\/measur.walmart_attribute_doc: Wheelbase ==> The distance between the front and rear axles of a vehicle. Important component of vehicle stability and maneuverability.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::wheelbase\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Wheelbase ==> The distance between the front and rear axles of a vehicle. Important component of vehicle stability and maneuverability.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::curbWeight\/measu.walmart_attribute_doc: Curb Weight ==> Total weight of a vehicle with standard equipment and all necessary support products (motor oil, fuel, coolant) but without either passengers or cargo.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::curbWeight\/unit.walmart_attribute_doc: Curb Weight ==> Total weight of a vehicle with standard equipment and all necessary support products (motor oil, fuel, coolant) but without either passengers or cargo.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::towingCapacity\/m.walmart_attribute_doc: Towing Capacity ==> Maximum weight that can be pulled by the vehicle. This tow rating is specified by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::towingCapacity\/u.walmart_attribute_doc: Towing Capacity ==> Maximum weight that can be pulled by the vehicle. This tow rating is specified by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::assembledProductL.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::assembledProductW.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::assembledProductH.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::variantGroupId.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::variantAttributeN.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::isPrimaryVariant.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::isProp65WarningRe.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::prop65WarningText.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::batteryTechnology.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
Vehicle\/LandVehicles::batteryTechnology.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::hasWarranty.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::warrantyURL.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::warrantyText.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::hasFuelContainer.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::compositeWoodCert.walmart_attribute_doc: Composite Wood Certification Code ==> Composite Wood - Indicates if any portion of the item contains any of the following types of composite wood: hardwood plywood veneer core, hardwood plywood composite core, particleboard, or medium density fiber board (MDF). Enter the code corresponding to the highest formaldehyde emission level on any portion of the item. Code Definitions: 1 - Does not contain composite wood; 7 - Product is not CARB compliant and cannot be sold in California; 8 - Product is CARB compliant and can be sold in California.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::requiresTextileAc.walmart_attribute_doc: Requires Textile Act Labeling ==> Select "Y" if your item contains wool or is one of the following: clothing (except for hats and shoes), handkerchiefs, scarves, bedding (including sheets, covers, blankets, comforters, pillows, pillowcases, quilts, bedspreads and pads (but not outer coverings for mattresses or box springs)), curtains and casements, draperies, tablecloths, napkins, doilies, floor coverings (rugs, carpets and mats), towels, washcloths, dishcloths, ironing board covers and pads, umbrellas, parasols, bats or batting, flags with heading or that are bigger than 216 square inches, cushions, all fibers, yarns and fabrics (but not packaging ribbons), furniture slip covers and other furniture covers, afghans and throws, sleeping bags, antimacassars (doilies), hammocks, dresser and other furniture scarves. For further information on these requirements, refer to the labeling requirements of the Textile Act.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::countryOfOriginTe.walmart_attribute_doc: Country of Origin - Textiles ==> Use “Made in U.S.A. and Imported” to indicate manufacture in the U.S. from imported materials, or part processing in the U.S. and part in a foreign country. Use “Made in U.S.A. or Imported” to reflect that some units of an item originate from a domestic source and others from a foreign source. Use “Made in U.S.A.” only if all units were made completely in the U.S. using materials also made in the U.S. Use "Imported" if units are completely imported.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::fabricContent.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::features.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Vehicle\/LandVehicles::keywords.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::sho.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::key.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::bra.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::man.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::mod.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::uni.walmart_attribute_doc: Package Count ==> The number of units in the item being offered for sale, such that each unit is packaged for individual sale and has a scannable bar code. Examples of Package Count: (1) A product containing a single package of 3 T-shirts has a "Package Count" of 1. (2) A product containing 2 packages each with 3 T-shirts has a "Package Count" of 2. (3) A product containing 2 packages of 36 count diapers has a "Package Count" of 2.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::mul.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::cou.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::pie.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::mai.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::pro.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::col.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::for.walmart_attribute_doc: Form ==> Describes the way the item is dispensed or consumed, including its texture or other physical characteristics.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::sha.walmart_attribute_doc: Shape ==> Physical shape of the item. Used in a wide variety of products including rugs, toys and large appliances.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::siz.walmart_attribute_doc: Size ==> Overall dimensions of an item. Used only for products that do not already have a more specific 'x size' attribute, such as ring size or clothing size.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fin.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fil.walmart_attribute_doc: Fill Material ==> The material used to stuff the item (in a cushion or plush toy, for example).

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::com.walmart_attribute_doc: Compatible Cars ==> List of the vehicles that are compatible with or fit with the item. Used primarily for vehicle parts and accessories. Allows selection using appropriate level of year, make and model information.
Compatible Brands ==> A list of the brands most commonly compatible with the item.
Compatible Devices ==> A list of the devices compatible with the item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isP.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Powered ==> Y indicates that an item uses electricity, requiring a power cord or batteries to operate. Useful for items that have non-powered equivalents (e.g. toothbrushes).

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::pow.walmart_attribute_doc: Power Type ==> Provides information on the exact type of power used by the item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::flu.walmart_attribute_doc: Fluid Ounces ==> Number of liquid ounces of the product in the individual container. Used for products such as cleaning supplies and automotive care products.
Fluid Ounces ==> Number of liquid ounces of the product in the individual container. Used for products such as cleaning supplies and automotive care products.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::amp.walmart_attribute_doc: Amps ==> Number of amps as a measure of electrical current draw. For products such as appliances, amps are usually specified as a peak value to help consumers select items that not overload household circuits. Also used as a measure of capacity (trip level) for electrical products such as circuit breakers and fuses

Amps ==> Number of amps as a measure of electrical current draw. For products such as appliances, amps are usually specified as a peak value to help consumers select items that not overload household circuits. Also used as a measure of capacity (trip level) for electrical products such as circuit breakers and fuses

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::col.walmart_attribute_doc: Cold Crank Amp ==> Number of amps a battery can deliver at 0 degrees F (−18 degrees C) for 30 seconds, as specified by the manufacturer. The CCA measurement is typically applied to lead-acid car batteries. Important in selection the appropriate battery to accommodate electrical demand requirements for a vehicle‘s engine to start, especially in cold weather.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::bea.walmart_attribute_doc: Beam Spread ==> Measurement of the spread of light from a reflectorized light source. The width of the beam spread is typically specified by the manufacturer for a certain beam angle, as measured from a given distance. For example, a light with a beam angle of 20 degrees that has a 1.8 foot beam spread from 5 feet away. Feature used by consumers as an indicator of performance for products such as headlights and security lights.

Beam Spread ==> Measurement of the spread of light from a reflectorized light source. The width of the beam spread is typically specified by the manufacturer for a certain beam angle, as measured from a given distance. For example, a light with a beam angle of 20 degrees that has a 1.8 foot beam spread from 5 feet away. Feature used by consumers as an indicator of performance for products such as headlights and security lights.

Beam Angle ==> The angle that corresponds to point at which the intensity of a source drops to 50% of maximum (center reading) measured in degrees of the full angle. Used as a component of light performance in products such as headlights and security lights.

Beam Angle ==> The angle that corresponds to point at which the intensity of a source drops to 50% of maximum (center reading) measured in degrees of the full angle. Used as a component of light performance in products such as headlights and security lights.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::inD.walmart_attribute_doc: In-Dash System ==> Y indicates the item is built into the dash of a vehicle vs. a portable, stand-alone unit. Examples include a head unit car stereo and an in-dash GPS navigation system.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::int.walmart_attribute_doc: Interface Type ==> Industry term describing the electronic connection enabling devices to communicate with each other. Used in a wide variety of electronic products including cables, computers, and cameras. Important selection factor for compatibility. For example, a cable that allows transfer of photos from a digital camera to a computer using a USB interface.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::dis.walmart_attribute_doc: Display Technology ==> The primary technology used for the item's display.

Display Resolution ==> If the item has a screen display, the resolution value of the screen component of the product. Typically measured as the number of pixels creating the display expressed as number of columns x number of rows. For example, a digital camera's screen resolution (vs. the image quality the camera can produce) of 640x480.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fas.walmart_attribute_doc: Fastener Head Type ==> Important selection criteria for intended use, and to match fasteners with the drive type of the tool necessary to install the fastener. For example, a Phillips head screw type is installed using a Phillips screwdriver.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::con.walmart_attribute_doc: Connector Type ==> The standardized connections provided on the item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::cab.walmart_attribute_doc: Cable Length ==> The total length of the cable (including connectors), measured in feet.
Cable Length ==> The total length of the cable (including connectors), measured in feet.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::cha.walmart_attribute_doc: Chain Length ==> Enter length of jewelry chain, in inches or feet.
Chain Length ==> Enter length of jewelry chain, in inches or feet.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::can.walmart_attribute_doc: Candle Power ==> Measurement of light intensity emitted by an item. Primarily used to describe the brightness of high-power spotlights.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fue.walmart_attribute_doc: Fuel Type ==> The kind of material that a product consumes to produce heat or power. Attribute is also used to classify a fuel product.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fla.walmart_attribute_doc: Flash Point ==> Lowest temperature at which the product gives off sufficient vapor to ignite, as specified by the manufacturer. Applies to products such as motor oil, machine lubricants and automatic transmission fluid. Materials with lower flash points such as acetone, with a flash point of 0 degrees F, pose a greater hazard because they are more flammable than a motor oil with a flash point of 420 degrees F.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fil.walmart_attribute_doc: Filter Life ==> Measurement of time or capacity of a filter before replacement is recommended by the manufacturer. For example, a filter life of a vehicle oil filter that is given as 10,000 miles.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::lig.walmart_attribute_doc: Light Bulb Type ==> Category of light bulb based on method to produce the light. Important to consumers because each type has different characteristics including bulb life, energy efficiency and color temperature. For example LED bulbs have a greater bulb life than equivalent incandescent bulbs.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isL.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Lockable ==> Y indicates the item has the capability to be secured by a lock or a locking mechanism. Differentiates lockability as a feature of items such as a tool boxes, microscopes, or saddlebags.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isR.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Reusable ==> Indicates the item can be used more than once.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::bre.walmart_attribute_doc: Breaking Strength ==> Measurement of the greatest stress, especially in tension, that a material is capable of withstanding without rupture or failure, as specified by the manufacturer. Not to be used for Working Load Limit, which is 1/3 the breaking strength. For example, a cargo strap with a breaking strength of 15,000 pounds will have a Working Load Limit of 5,000 pounds.

Breaking Strength ==> Measurement of the greatest stress, especially in tension, that a material is capable of withstanding without rupture or failure, as specified by the manufacturer. Not to be used for Working Load Limit, which is 1/3 the breaking strength. For example, a cargo strap with a breaking strength of 15,000 pounds will have a Working Load Limit of 5,000 pounds.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::max.walmart_attribute_doc: Maximum Motor Speed ==> The maximum speed of the motor measured in revolutions per minute, as specified by the manufacturer. Attribute typically used to describe DC motors such as vehicle heater blowers and fan motors.
Maximum Temperature ==> The higher temperature limit or capacity of an item such as a heater or thermometer.
Maximum Temperature ==> The higher temperature limit or capacity of an item such as a heater or thermometer.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::num.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Outlets ==> Number of outlets an item has. Typically used to describe number of electrical outlets for products such as cigarette lighter adapters and power surge protectors. Attribute also used for number of pipes or holes for liquid or gas to go out of an item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::rec.walmart_attribute_doc: Receiver Compatibility ==> Size that describes the interface between a vehicle receiver-type hitch and trailer attachment hardware. Important for assembling a towing system. For example, a 2 inch ball mount, would be compatible with a 2 inch receiver hitch.

Receiver Compatibility ==> Size that describes the interface between a vehicle receiver-type hitch and trailer attachment hardware. Important for assembling a towing system. For example, a 2 inch ball mount, would be compatible with a 2 inch receiver hitch.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::res.walmart_attribute_doc: Reserve Capacity ==> Battery runtime in minutes at a steady discharge of amperage, as specified by the manufacturer. RC is important to consumers because it is a measure of the power available to meet vehicle’s electrical demand (lights, windshield wipers, etc.) if the charging systems fail.

Reserve Capacity ==> Battery runtime in minutes at a steady discharge of amperage, as specified by the manufacturer. RC is important to consumers because it is a measure of the power available to meet vehicle’s electrical demand (lights, windshield wipers, etc.) if the charging systems fail.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::loa.walmart_attribute_doc: Rated Load Capacity ==> The maximum load, expressed in psi, that the product is designed to have applied to it.
Rated Load Capacity ==> The maximum load, expressed in psi, that the product is designed to have applied to it.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::hor.walmart_attribute_doc: Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). Horsepower is also used as common rating on electric motors and products that contain them.

Horsepower ==> Measurement of the power of the device. Significance of horsepower varies with type of product. For example, for products with engines, horsepower is a general indicator of an engine's size and power (along with other engine specifications of engine displacement and torque). Horsepower is also used as common rating on electric motors and products that contain them.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::sae.walmart_attribute_doc: SAE DOT-Compliant ==> Y indicates that the item meets the standards for vehicle lighting developed by the US Department of Transportation (DOT) and the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE). Lights that are compliant usually have a SAE identification code molded into the plastic (e.g. SAE AIST 09 DOT).

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::sha.walmart_attribute_doc: Shackle Clearance ==> Measurement of the height opening of the shackle. If product is a padlock, it is the distance between the top of the lock and the bottom of the shackle.
Shackle Clearance ==> Measurement of the height opening of the shackle. If product is a padlock, it is the distance between the top of the lock and the bottom of the shackle.
Shackle Diameter ==> Measurement of the thickness of metal u-shaped bar portion of the shackle. Used for products such anchor shackles for boat rigging systems, and for padlock shackles.
Shackle Diameter ==> Measurement of the thickness of metal u-shaped bar portion of the shackle. Used for products such anchor shackles for boat rigging systems, and for padlock shackles.

Shackle Length ==> Measurement of the length of a shackle. Important selection factor for shackles that are designed for specific applications such as a component of a vehicle suspension system, or as part of a padlock.

Shackle Length ==> Measurement of the length of a shackle. Important selection factor for shackles that are designed for specific applications such as a component of a vehicle suspension system, or as part of a padlock.
Shank Length ==> Measurement of the length of the shank portion of an item. Selection factor based on towing rig compatibility for products such as ball-type trailer hitches.
Shank Length ==> Measurement of the length of the shank portion of an item. Selection factor based on towing rig compatibility for products such as ball-type trailer hitches.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::she.walmart_attribute_doc: Shear Strength ==> Measurement of the force, expressed in pounds, required to induce structural failure due to a sliding force along a plane parallel to the direction of the force. Typically applied to products such as towing and construction hardware.

Shear Strength ==> Measurement of the force, expressed in pounds, required to induce structural failure due to a sliding force along a plane parallel to the direction of the force. Typically applied to products such as towing and construction hardware.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::hit.walmart_attribute_doc: Hitch Class ==> Rating applied to trailer hitch receivers based on the maximum weight capacity for towing, and receiver opening size. The classes range from Class I to V, with Class V having the highest capacity and largest receiver opening size. Hitch class designation helps consumers select the right hitch for their vehicle and indented use.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::dro.walmart_attribute_doc: Drop Distance ==> Measurement of the distance the towing hardware (e. g. ball mount) lowers a trailer connector (e.g. towing ball) to allow a trailer to be level when towed.
Drop Distance ==> Measurement of the distance the towing hardware (e. g. ball mount) lowers a trailer connector (e.g. towing ball) to allow a trailer to be level when towed.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::ass.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Width ==> The width of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Height ==> The height of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.
Assembled Product Weight ==> The weight of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::var.walmart_attribute_doc: Variant Group ID ==> Required if item is a variant. Make up a number and/or letter code for “Variant Group ID” and add this to all variations of the same product. Partners must ensure uniqueness of their Variant Group IDs.
Variant Attribute Names ==> Designate all attributes by which the item is varying. Variant attributes are limited to those designated for each category.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isP.walmart_attribute_doc: Is Primary Variant ==> Note whether item is intended as the main variant in a variant grouping. The primary variant will appear as the image when customers search and the first image displayed on the item page. This should be set as "Yes" for only one item in a group of variants.

Is Prop 65 Warning Required ==> Selecting "Y" indicates the product requires California's Proposition 65 special warning. Proposition 65 entitles California consumers to special warnings for products that contain chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm if certain criteria are met (such as quantity of chemical contained in the product). See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 for more information.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::pro.walmart_attribute_doc: Prop 65 Warning Text ==> This is a particular statement legally required by the State of California for certain products to warn consumers about potential health dangers. See the portions of the California Health and Safety Code related to Proposition 65 to see what products require labels and to verify the text of your warning label.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::bat.walmart_attribute_doc: Contained Battery Type ==> Please select the Battery Technology Type from the list provided. NOTE: If battery type is lead acid, lead acid (nonspillable), lithium ion, or lithium metal, please ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.
Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::bat.walmart_attribute_enum: Does Not Contain a Battery,Alkaline,Carbon Zinc,Lead Acid,Lead Acid (Nonspillable),Lithium Primary (Lithium Metal),Lithium Ion,Magnesium,Mercury,Nickel Cadmium,Nickel Metal Hydride,Silver,Thermal,Other,Multiple Types

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isA.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Aerosol ==> ‘Aerosol’ is defined by Walmart to include any item of Merchandise that contains a compressed gas or propellant (including bag-on-valve and other pressurized designs). If your product meets this definition, Mark Y and ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::isC.walmart_attribute_doc: Contains Chemical ==> ‘Chemical’ is defined by Walmart to include any item of Merchandise that contains a powder, gel, paste, or liquid that is not intended for human consumption. ‘Chemical’ also includes the following types items that ARE intended for human consumption, inhalation, or absorption, or labeled with drug facts: All over-the-counter medications, including: Lozenges, pills or capsules (e.g. pain relievers; allergy medications; as well as vitamins and supplements that contain metals); Medicated swabs and wipes, acne medication, and sunscreen; Medicated patches (such as nicotine patches); Liquids (e.g. cough medicine, medicated drops, nasal spray and inhalers); Medicated shampoos, gums, ointments and creams; Medicated lip balm, lip creams and petroleum jelly; Contraceptive foam, films, and spermicides; and Product/Equipment sold with chemicals (e.g. vaporizer sold with medication) and electronic cigarettes. If your product meets this definition, Mark Y and ensure that you have obtained a hazardous materials risk assessment through WERCS before setting up your item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::com.walmart_attribute_doc: Composite Wood Certification Code ==> Composite Wood - Indicates if any portion of the item contains any of the following types of composite wood: hardwood plywood veneer core, hardwood plywood composite core, particleboard, or medium density fiber board (MDF). Enter the code corresponding to the highest formaldehyde emission level on any portion of the item. Code Definitions: 1 - Does not contain composite wood; 7 - Product is not CARB compliant and cannot be sold in California; 8 - Product is CARB compliant and can be sold in California.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::has.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Warranty ==> Y indicates the item comes with a warranty. If an item has a warranty, then enter EITHER the warranty URL or the warranty text in the appropriate field.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::war.walmart_attribute_doc: Warranty URL ==> If you indicated that your item has a warranty, provide either the Warranty URL or Warranty Text. The Warranty URL is the web location of the image, PDF, or link to the manufacturer's warranty page, showing the warranty and its terms, including the duration of the warranty. URLs must begin with http:// or https:// NOTE: Please remember to update the link and/or text of the warranty as the warranty changes. If supplying an image, provide the final destination image URL (no-redirects) that is publicly accessible (no username/password required) and ends in a proper image extension. Recommended file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Maximum file size: 2 GB. If the Ingredients have been included in another image, you may repeat the URL here.

Warranty Text ==> If you marked Y for "Has Warranty" provide the Warranty URL or Warranty Text (the full text of the warranty terms, including what is covered by the warranty and the duration of the warranty). NOTE: please remember to update the text of your warranty as your warranty changes.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::has.walmart_attribute_doc: Has Fuel Container ==> Denotes any item with an empty container that may be filled with fluids, such as fuel, CO2, propane, etc.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::veh.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Category ==> Grouping of different kinds of vehicles based on use and form. Important selection criteria, especially for compatibility, for products including boat components, tires and auto accessories. Vehicle Type also used for toys such as model rocket ships and remote-controlled race cars.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::mot.walmart_attribute_doc: Motor Oil Viscosity ==> The grade designation as determined by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE) corresponding to viscosity is the oil's resistance to flow. Multigrade motor oil grades consists of two numbers, e.g. 10W-40: 10W refers to the low-temperature viscosity ("Winter"), 40 refers to the high-temperature viscosity ("Summer").

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fab.walmart_attribute_doc: Fabric Content ==> Material makeup of the item.

Fabric Care Instructions ==> Describes how the fabric should be cleaned. Enter details of the fabric care label found on the item. (For garments, typically located inside on the top of the back or the lower left side.)

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::spo.walmart_attribute_doc: Sports League ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports league, enter the league name. Abbreviations are fine. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.
Sports Team ==> If your item has any association with a specific sports team, enter the team name. NOTE: This attribute flags an item for inclusion in the online fan shop.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::ath.walmart_attribute_doc: Athlete ==> A well-known athlete associated with a product, if applicable. This is used to group items in Fan Shop, not to describe a line of clothing.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::aut.walmart_attribute_doc: Autographed by ==> The full name of the person who has autographed this copy.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::fea.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Features ==> List notable features of the item.

Vehicle\/VehiclePartsAndAccessories::key.walmart_attribute_doc: Keywords ==> Words that people would use to search for this item. Keywords can include synonyms and related terms.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::short.walmart_attribute_doc: Description ==> Overview of the key selling points of the item, marketing content, and highlights in paragraph form. For SEO purposes, repeat the product name and relevant keywords here.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::keyFe.walmart_attribute_doc: Key Features ==> Key features will appear as bulleted text on the item page and in search results. Key features help the user understand the benefits of the product with a simple and clean format. We highly recommended using three or more key features.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::brand.walmart_attribute_doc: Brand ==> Name, term, design or other feature that distinguishes one seller's product from those of others. This can be the name of the company associated with the product, but not always. If item does not have a brand, use "Unbranded".

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::manuf.walmart_attribute_doc: Manufacturer ==> Manufacturer is the maker of the product. This is the name of the company that produces the product, not necessarily the brand name of the item. For some products, the manufacturer and the brand may be the same.

Manufacturer Part Number ==> MPN uniquely identifies the product to its manufacturer. For many products this will be identical to the model number. Some manufacturers distinguish part number from model number. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::model.walmart_attribute_doc: Model Number ==> Model numbers allow manufacturers to keep track of each hardware device and identify or replace the proper part when needed. Model numbers are often found on the bottom, back, or side of a product. Having this information allows customers to search for items on the site and informs product matching.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::multi.walmart_attribute_doc: Multipack Quantity ==> The number of identical, individually packaged-for-sale items. If an item does not contain other items, does not contain identical items, or if the items contained within cannot be sold individually, the value for this attribute should be "1." Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Multipack Quantity" of 2. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Multipack Quantity" of "6." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Multipack Quantity" of "1."

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::count.walmart_attribute_doc: Count Per Pack ==> The number of identical items inside each individual pack given by the "Multipack Quantity" attribute. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of "50." (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Count Per Pack" of 50. (3) A 6-pack of soda labelled for individual sale connected by plastic rings has a "Count Per Pack" of "1." (4) A 6-pack of soda in a box whose cans are not marked for individual sale has a "Count Per Pack" of "6." (5) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Count Per Pack" of "1."

Total Count ==> The total number of identical items in the package or box; a result of the multiplication of Multipack Quantity by Count Per Pack. Examples: (1) A single bottle of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 50. (2) A package containing two identical bottles of 50 pills has a "Total Count" of 100. (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Total Count" of 1.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::mainI.walmart_attribute_doc: Main Image URL ==> Main image of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::produ.walmart_attribute_doc: Additional Image URL ==> Secondary images of the item. Image URL must end in the file name. Image URL must be static and have no redirections. Preferred file type: JPEG Accepted file types: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP Recommended image resolution: 3000 x 3000 pixels at 300 ppi. Minimum image size requirements: Zoom capability: 2000 x 2000 pixels at 300 ppi. Non-zoom minimum: 500 x 500 pixels at 72 ppi. Maximum file size: 2 MB.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::color.walmart_attribute_doc: Color ==> Color as described by the manufacturer.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::finis.walmart_attribute_doc: Finish ==> Terms describing the overall external treatment applied to the item. Typically finishes give a distinct appearance, texture or additional performance to the item. This attribute is used in a wide variety products and materials including wood, metal and fabric.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::mater.walmart_attribute_doc: Material ==> The main material(s) that a product is made of. This does not need to be an exhaustive list, but should contain the predominant or functionally important material/materials. Fabric material specifics should be entered using the "Fabric Content" attribute.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::vehic.walmart_attribute_doc: Vehicle Rim Size ==> The measurement of the diameter and width of a vehicle wheel.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::diame.walmart_attribute_doc: Diameter ==> The measurement from one side of a circle to the other, through the middle.
Diameter ==> The measurement from one side of a circle to the other, through the middle.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::compa.walmart_attribute_doc: Compatible Tire Size ==> Size(s) of tire that will fit on this wheel.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::numbe.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Spokes ==> Number of spokes on a wheel. Important selection factor for strength and visual design. For example, many consumers prefer the classic 5 spoke design for car wheels.

Vehicle\/WheelsAndWheelComponents::assem.walmart_attribute_doc: Assembled Product Length ==> The length of the fully assembled product. NOTE: This information is shown on the item page.

Vehicle\/VehicleOther::pieceCount.walmart_attribute_doc: Number of Pieces ==> The number of small pieces, slices, or different items within the product. Piece Count applies to things such as puzzles, building block sets, and products that contain multiple different items (such as tool sets, dinnerware sets, gift baskets, art sets, makeup kits, or shaving kits). EXAMPLE: (1) A 500-piece puzzle has a "Piece Count" of 500. (2) A 105-Piece Socket Wrench set has a piece count of "105." (3) A gift basket of 5 different items has a "Piece Count" of 5.
